YYrlL1xRDqW-HZ0txXEJpw.text: It was good. Just not what I was expecting. Super small menu. Basically 0 vegetarian options, which left out people in our dinner party. The bowl of Raman in the picture is black truffle Raman. Again, the food was good. I was just expecting an array of flavors. Which was disappointing because, it looked delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jQXv9yfwZKq8uzGWpSxVdg.text: Small selection of draft beers is the only reason I took this from 5 to 4 stars. A group of 3 of us ordered the family style pork shoulder and it was the most tender pork shoulder I have ever had, and we had about half of it leftover! We loved the oysters that came with our selection and they brought an ample amount of butter lettuce so we could build our own lettuce wraps, too!

IqEGsDB0aiDcmbv8XFncAA.text: Went here Thursday for a bday. Got the lobster shrimp combo. One word..amazing! 6 lobster tails, dozen jumbo shrimp with that crunch and sauce! It says feed 2-4,  but it can feed 4-5. The cold spicey noodles were really good. The cucumber app were also really good. Had a great time here. Everyone were really nice.  Kind of pricey, but for a special occasion like this, it was worth it.

j--f88lxO15cAxAAMahlzA.text: Must try the pork belly buns and shrimp patty buns.  The pork ramen was also pretty tasty. I would skip on the bo saam rice bowl - way too overpriced for what you get, but it is flavorful.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bo ssam rice bowl
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly bun is delicious!

wFEpgjE_PVmwEOQosAcx-w.text: Round TWO. I was invited back and had the best night in Vegas that night. Totally different vibe than my first visit. Had an amazing view of the strip...City lights setting the tone. I started out with the peppers, spicy cucumbers, brussel sprouts and cauliflower... all we're tasty and I never liked brussel sprouts. Next was the tri tip (for myself) and salmon(wifey). Both were A-MAYY-ZING. I highly recommend the tri-tip, I was cutting it with a butter knife... so tasty. I am not a top food critic but I do love food and wine. I enjoy the art and science of it all. So when I tried the Pinot Noir recommended with the dish, it made my taste buds dance. Then dessert!!! Awwhh... I was a happy camper. Did I mention a contestant from "Chopped" works there? I love that show which made the night extra special. I even got an autograph buttttt left it in my hotel on the nightstand. Kicking myself for that ... anywho. Try this place out. I will be returning during my next visit. Shout out to Victor, Mags, the sommelier guy, and every one else who made my birthday memorable.  Thanks again.

Qbq_435cCasbhRggEw4IFg.text: So I was mentally prepared to love Momofuku - I have read cookbook which is as much a history of the development of the concept and have never been able to get into their NYC restaurant - so happy to see they opened in Vegas and more than excited to finally try it out and it was very good but there were some service flaws that affected the whole meal.  This was a business dinner and you should know the place if loud - music cranked up so everyone talks louder and you can't really hear the person across the table - we were at a round table and the conversation could only be with the two parties to either side - I know it is Vegas - just understand that is the gig.  Arrive on time and our table wasn't ready - not a big deal the whole party wasn't there but it took close to a half hour for the table and once it was ready the hostess said clear the bar tab and come find her - not sure that's the way it should work - happy to clear the tab but how about you take the rest of the group to the table.  The bar has a fairly limited beer menu - not shocking but a large selection of specialty drinks - more on that later.  As far as the venue goes - Momofuku is a beautiful restaurant, touch dark but urban/modern decor great graffiti-ish wall mural - made us feel a little under dressed. Well after 9:00 when we sat for our 8:30 reservation and then we had to wait a bit - five minutes or so for our waitress to show - it seems we also had someone helping with drinks but he came and discussed gin - got one drink - failed to get another and we never saw him again.  Our main waitress was nice and knowledge about the menu and was helpful with recommendations - in fact we basically went with what she suggested.  So have gone half a page and not mention food - so lets start for real - Momofuku is meant to be family style dining with a large lazy susan in the middle of the table to rotate selections around the group - cool.  Started with the Spicy Cucumbers and Shishito Peppers - both were good but would lean to the cucumber, large hunks vs slices lightly dusted in togarashi and (olive?) oil with almonds it was light but quite good.  The peppers were fine with a bit of a smokey taste but nothing you haven't had before.  So our waitress said go with the duck and we did - it says serves 3-4 - we have five and it was plenty but we did get a couple smaller entrees as well.  What was not explained is exactly how to consume the Rotisserie Duck - turns out you use the lettuce wraps and chive pancakes with toppings/sauce - understand that that is seems obvious now but never having ordered it everyone was a bit confused - bottom line is the Duck is amazing - brought to the table and carved into perfect 1/4" inch slices then laid out over a huge bowl of sticky rice - the skin seared to crispiness and the duck meat so juicy you didn't really need and of the accompanied sauces - I would be hard pressed to not order it again.  Bonus went the duck was gone I used the ssam sauce and ginger scallion sauce over the rice.  Other highlights were the Grilled Lamb Ribs - just a touch of yogurt sauce was all the needed - they let the lamb be the star of the show - this one said it feeds two but we all had a rib and were happy.  Also tried the Chilled Spicy Noodles with sichuan sausage, thai basil and candied cashew - another must order - the mostly green dish had a subtle heat but was mostly refreshing - great paring with the heavier duck and lamb.  One quick note again on the service side - I ordered their specialty Old Fashion when the food was ordered - didn't receive it until we were well into the main course - worse it was fantastic - more of a Manhattan with rich bourbon and only the tiniest hint of sweetness and I would have had two if I had started earlier.  Two sides for the table were the Brussels Sprouts & Cauliflower - crisp and delicious and Asparagus - which were just okay, maybe the only thing we had that I wouldn't order again.  Could leave without trying something from Milk Bar and again listened to our waitress and got the Crack Pie with Cereal Milk Ice Cream - the pie is so dense it is a thick caramel delight and pares with not as sweet as you expect ice cream - shared among five it was a great finish to the meal.  Summary - food was outstanding and assuming some service glitches get resolved it will be up on the top end of the Vegas restaurant scene.

w_betPgDdtZ3rY9YOeV22Q.text: Food is great! Price is definitely not worth the portion size, but it's a nice place to try at least once when you're in town.

MG_HtvbUfORpc8DAgGkjCA.text: The lamb ribs and pork belly buns are absolutely amazing, I don't know how they managed to pack so much flavor into one dish!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UNb7JG5PiJVvk53HgJGUqw.text: This was legitimately one of the best meals I have had in my life.  Every single thing that we tried, from the drinks to salad to entree, was absolutely amazing.  Listen to your servers suggestions because they know what they are talking about.  I will be raving about this for a very long time!

y8Re_H0zUmN6DY2JR0SWnQ.text: I went here twice in two days. I had 4 different cocktails and they were all excellent. I could eat the spicy cucumbers every day for the rest of my life.  Waitstaff was awesome. I had a nice conversation with the bartender about different cocktails.  I was a solo diner both times and I didn't get overlooked, which can so often happen. This lives up to the hype.

omarrpyWxJ5_VJOd8GCBtA.text: I am so angry. I made a reservation 1 month in advance. I moved my reservation up one hour and wouldn't be accommodated. I understand this is a busy establishment.  But having made a reservation one month in advance I am livid that I could not be accommodated for having had to move my reservation. Poor management.

1etQlRxo5XappBXkmQFeew.text: If you want to make memories with friends and family, this is the place to be. We celebrate my sons 4th Birthday there and they treated us like we're celebrities. I was beyond grateful for the exceptional service and great food. Highly recommend this place.

Eu9QCoW7kKlOalM1-2CD6Q.text: Wow. One of the best meals I've ever had. I will be returning as soon as I can.   This restaurant balances simple dishes with complex ingredients, mixing flavors and textures to create perfection. We had the lamb and the ginger noodles and the cucumber app with peanuts. Wow, all spectacular. Ambiance is beautiful and comforting. Staff was awesome. We had a drink called the Penicillin  - literally one of the best drinks I've ever had.   Please come to LA, Momofuku!! We need you!

iO8xPoJY2WL7A_0UmRL9jQ.text: The lobster and shrimp dish was so flavorful and dynamic. Its the dish to get when you're treating yourself out and in Vegas, its all about going all out, isn't it. Highly recommend it. Afterwards, follow it up with some Milk Bar dessert! You won't regret it!

w6oRHOg_WtvWDwcdTMVoVQ.text: This place is absolutely amazing ! It's must to try for sure! The pricing is good for the quality of the food you receive

zp-D-gBmzh9wR2TDDNroPA.text: Amazing food paired with amazing service! This is where the birthday girl chose for her birthday dinner and they delivered! We are a family with Japanese heritage, restaurant owners ourselves and the flavours were on point!  Great Job Momofuku LV, huge plus with Milk next door as well! Thank you!

xJQbaEWnJmyxIPIoBhJV5Q.text: Three words...Spicy Chilled Noodles.  Just a great spot, cool location, nice vibe.  We sat at the kitchen bar and got to see all of the dishes being prepared.  Hearts of Palm salad was really well done and tasted fantastic.  We will be back for sure.

Pqs4i2mn48_ol3p25YJ8rg.text: I had a fond experience/memory of dining here but unfortunately I don't recall anything that I ordered. By having said that it means none of the items ordered was special or outstanding. I came here because I tried their ramen in NY. Looking forward to try it's sister restaurant in LA.

6z8osVBI28w2eX-a4cUuHA.text: Went here for the first time today and thoroughly enjoyed the experience.  Service: perfectly paced, friendly, knowledgeable  Food: spicy cucumbers, shrimp bun, ginger scallion noodles, bucatini, and king salmon were all fantastic. The ginger scallion noodles were my favorite.   We skipped dessert because we had already been to Milk Bar twice this trip, but I would highly recommend the crack pie (if you like sweet!) and the cereal milk soft serve (perfectly balanced sweet and salty).

Zx7AEmBNwrL2nKUDEy9Ubg.text: Loved the chickpea ramen!! The broth was so rich and tasty, I just wanted a mug of the stuff. Also had the shrimp and pork buns which were very good. Great place for a wonderful filling meal.

dv6TWzAlfVlQaOraz1HDnA.text: Definitely not worth what you pay. Mediocre food decent service but horrible value. I read another reviews that it was the best ramen that they had in their life I'd disagree at the $50 price point probably not worth it.

JufCb5qJp2VlTtjI4mS8QA.text: Second time around and went for lunch. Really love David Chang but the food here just didn't quite cut it for me - and especially with their current prices. Service was ok but not great. Atmosphere is nice with an open kitchen and nice views. The pork belly bun was fairly standard - meat was extra fatty for pork belly. The noodle dishes were ok, best bites were the pickled mushrooms. Flavors across the board just weren't very bold. For two it was closer to 80 bucks and there are a ton of way better ramen options in town for cheaper.  Solid 3/5

1swmyCKCK9ujhUWw0JKkhw.text: We started with the pork belly sliders.. which was a wonderful bite. I ordered the shoyu pork ramen and my fiance ordered the bossam bowl (I'm happy he did, because he wanted to order the ramen too) My ramen was good. The pork was tender the egg was cooked beautifully. The broth was light and good... But the bowl was bursting with so many flavors it kind of outshined the ramen. I just loved it. We ended up switching halfway through and I kept his until I was fill, then he finished it. Would love to try more dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gfg8-8DFMOrfWBxozJ0lcg.text: I've always wanted to visit one of David Chang's restaurant so I was pretty excited to come here when I was in Vegas for the weekend. My friend and I shared one pork belly bun and the shoyu pork ramen. The thick pork belly was so juicy and tender. The bun was great on its own but the ssam sauce elevated it. It added a nice sweet and spicy kick to it. We both enjoyed the ramen since we were craving some soup after a night out in Vegas. Once again the pork belly tasted amazing. The ramen broth tasted a bit plain to us, so we had to ask for more spicy seasoning. It was very simple and tasted great, but nothing too memorable so it felt overpriced. I would come back if I had a big group of friends with me to try their family dishes. I will try the fried chicken with caviar some day! Overall an ok restaurant to enjoy a pricey meal if you want to indulge in some Asian dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jTfJ4ycF0qOh1iy4QJjgJg.text: Well worth the visit.  Made resos and got sat right away.  Surprisingly, it wasn't as packed on a late Friday night.  Pork Belly bun - Melt in your mouth pork belly! DELICIOUS. I would eat like 10 of these, if the price didn't hurt.  Uni Hashbrown - I thought this was a bit salty for me, but my friend enjoyed it.  Our two favorite things to eat in one place.  Uni and hashbrowns, who would of thought this amazing combo.  Chilled Spicy Noodles - The thai basil with the noodles + thai chilies + sausage + candied cashews were surprisingly so good together.  I don't like nuts in my food, but I didn't mind the cashews in this dish.  I would definitely order this noodle dish again.

CnM0rtiPE6rF47nwadiNqA.text: Hmmm....I didnt actually eat at restaurant but was with a group of 8 that is extremely serious about food.  I left to use the bathroom and when I came back it looked like someone had died.  The vibe was horrible.  Then one of them said I really dont like this.  Overall the food cooments were subpar including comments about McDonald's being better.  They enjoyed the pork belly but that was it.

y5h1kOD05PaZFVR57Hz1-Q.text: Best ramen I've ever had, hands down.   We went in for a late lunch this past Saturday. There was a tiny bit of a wait, but I thought it was gonna be a lot worse. Water isn't complimentary, but it's only a dollar per person. It's some fancy bottled water that I was convinced was the best tasting water I had ever had, but it was likely placebo.  Back to the best ramen I've ever had, hands down. The pork belly literally melts in your mouth. Pig has never tasted so good. It comes w/ a pretty sizable dollop of pork shoulder to satisfy your meat needs. The noodles were perfectly firm and the broth was delicious.  I'm really not even that big of a ramen guy, but I'm gonna try to hit this place up every time I'm in town. You've made a fan out of me, Momofuku!

2XP7lMsDqqQ9SVnEd0ALXA.text: Hands down the best Pork Shoyu Ramen. I popped the poached egg into my ramen so I can get the creaminess and it was amazing. Service is great and the wait is not too long. Our serve was very knowledgeable in answering all out questions about the food and also about places for site seeing. The water is served from fancy glass bottled water, really crisp. Overall, I would most definitely come here again if in Vegas.

w0qs1TMTuJTgRzGqAjwa5g.text: One of my favorite places and meals I have had in Vegas so far!  I stumbled upon this in the Cosmopolitan while trying to kill some time and it was the best surprise ever.  It had just opened and was fairly new so it was super clean, modern and beautiful.  Then again what restaurant in Vegas is not?  The line was crazy so I decided to just sit at the bar.  Started out with the oysters from the raw bar and Shishito Peppers.  They were so delicious and the smoked salt on them is delicious!  For the main dish I had the Sizzling A5 Hokkaido Wagyu and it was darn delicious!!  I was trying to scoop the sauce that was remaining up to eat.  Such a  great experience sitting at the bar as we were able to interact with the staff and see the whole restaurant fill up.  Cannot wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

E2S8iT6gb5uAflBzSz6edw.text: We didn't have a reservation and it was Saturday night so me and my girlfriends sat at the bar and had dinner. It was so much fun and Eric and Ryan were great host at the bar. My Wild Caught Alaskan Salmon was very tasty and I just wanted to lick the plate clean!!  My friends all got the Pot Belly wrap and it was very fatty and this might be normal for this type of meat (I don't eat pork). The cucumber salad and spicy noodles were excellent as was!

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lqwfmqkU1fB8ucW-tatR7g.text: So far I've been to this Momofuku location twice (once for a midday bar-seating snack, and again for a Mother's Day lunch), and while I admit that I won't go out of my way to come here unless I'm either craving it or already in the area (it's a long drive for me to get here), it has not yet failed to deliver and satisfy. The atmosphere is very casual but upscale, with a really stunning full wall mural/graffiti that made me feel as close to 'hipster' as I'll ever be. The wait staff were attentive and helpful, as our family struggled to narrow down our choices. They made some excellent recommendations for our meal!   My first ever item here was the Pork Belly Buns, which literally melt in your mouth. The buns were fresh and perfectly steamed, and the pork was well-seasoned with the perfect amount of tenderness. The Pork Ramen was definitely just as good - pork had the same qualities, and the noodles were the perfect thickness/chewiness: hearty, filling... I struggle for the right descriptor, but those that have been to Japan and eaten authentic ramen know that there is a 'thickness' to the noodles that I can't fully articulate. Regardless, David Chang and Momofuku nailed it on the ramen here. We also had the Crispy Potatoes on the wait staff's recommendation, and I was so glad we tried this because it's my new favorite: as described, they are crispy, but the accouterments, seasonings, and sauces MADE this. The Rotisserie Jidori Chicken - we ate it to the bone, so yes, it was delicious. The dry seasonings worried me because it made it look so dry, but it was absolutely moist and tender  on the inside. Plus, you can't go wrong with added lime.  Everything was memorable about my meals here, and I absolutely intend to go back for more!

Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Potatoes
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Ramen

0ZdXhiAVhcyJnOCMFfXRtw.text: Back in Vegas for pleasure and business conference. I enjoyed a lovely dinner at Momofuku in the Cosmopolitan resort with my wife. The milk bar just outside the restaurant caught our eye first and we had to try their latest adult milkshake offerings. I got the fancy chocolate shake while my wife got the "Golden Knight," named after the famous Vegas hockey team. With our orders getting made, the hostess at the restaurant was able to seat us right away and very graciously offered to bring us our drinks once they were ready. Didn't have to but I tipped her generously for her efforts. As expected, the drinks were amazing and we shared them together.  For dinner, we weren't starving so we shared a couple of small dishes. They do tapas style food. We shared the short rib kimchee stew which was delicious. They brought out 2 empty bowls and Asian soup spoons without us asking. The meat just melted in your mouth and the broth was just the right level of slickness and rich flavor without being overwhelming.  We highly recommend it. We also had to share the A5 Hokkaido Wagyu potatoes from their list of small dishes. Couldn't even finish it but loved the very thinly sliced wagyu beef and crunchy garlic covered small potato pieces. Very rich and delectable. Overall, staff and service were attentive and wonderful. Fun to people watch. Want to try their inside bar next time. Want to check out their seemingly generous whisky/whiskey selection. Decor reminded us of their New York bar with the usual Vegas charm. Definitely recommended to want to add some of the latest Asian fusion concoctions to your Vegas holiday and food adventure!

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lucky!
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kimchee stew

CdRJ7I7dWFv46VwlWP6p9Q.text: Wow Momofuku...I know there is so much hype and I know I should have expected to absolutely be satisfied but I was not expecting to fall aggressively head over heels in love with your food. This was my very first encounter with anything Dave Chang has touched and to be quite frank, long overdue.   This is just about as good as it gets and rating my experience with TL;DR notes would really be a total injustice. Keep reading for my Momofuku Love Diary Entry #1 :)  It was my last night in Vegas after a long winded trip with friends and so much vodka. Everyone already flew out earlier in the day so I really had the perfect opportunity to choose one spot I truly wanted to go to and have a solo self care date with me, myself and I. Of course Momo came to mind but I thought, well maybe it would be a basic and way too predictable choice. I wandered around the Miracle Mile completely buzzed and time window getting smaller to eat at world-renowned establishment. Instinctively, I hopped on OpenTable to see what was available. Beautifully enough there was one last seat for 10:30PM. I was about a 5 minute walk away and the time was 10:20PM. Pretty perfect act of fate.  I was seated at the kitchen bar to my shock, this place was calm and not overwhelming. My server donned a canvas apron that really made me feel connected to the chefs already. He gave me suggestions but was not too pushy. His enthusiasm for the food was very apparent and completely genuine. I started off with a singular pork belly bun and Hawaiian kampachi. The first bite of that bao is what I would imagine finding your soulmate feels like. It was the single most favorite bite of food I have ever had in my entire life. Maybe that is cliche, but that is the only way to describe it. The pork belly was thick and juicy fat seared to the perfect caramel color. A little crunch from the lightly pickled veggies paired with the airy cloud of bun was orgasmic in every single way. It shook every one of my senses and I'm drooling just writing this now. Kampachi was fresh and buttery. enough said. I ordered one more pork belly bun because I could not resist.   I got the A5 Wagyu next served over these garlicy bed of roasted golden potatoes. They were great but the stand alone absolute star of this dish was the thinly sliced beef that was marbled like heaven's butter. I can't even describe the those bites tasted. Words fail to encompass that sensation. Simple, subtle and so sophisticated. It was literally a symphony in my mouth ugh.   The last sweet little surprise of my night was a fellow solo diner sitting a few spots down from me. He had a big bowl of something that i was too eager to find out about. He told me it was a truffle ramen - not on the menu. Being an absolute truffle whore, I was so jealous I didn't get that. He was so sweet and actually gave me a bowl of his meal. If I could describe UMAMI as a dish, it would be that. The broth was rich and complex but not in a way that makes you regret it. I'm rendered a little speechless by my experience. It was a moment in time I will truly never forget. It has taught me to appreciate the simple things and small details.   Dave Chang, I am absolutely a fan. Thank you for sharing your soul with the World.   (Please see photos)

Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lQE5-PLwL3lK3jtCObIILw.text: We went in between lunch and dinner hours so were given the off hours menu I think. Just some starters, buns and noodles. I got the ginger scallion noodles with added egg and pork belly. It was so yummy, the egg was like an onsen egg and the pork belly was a thick slice with marbled fat throughout. My favorite part of the dish was the pickled shiitake mushrooms, I've never had that before and it was so refreshing and cut the fat of the pork really nicely. Our server was the best and honestly the nicest server I've ever had. 5 stars alone for the lovely interactions we had with him!

SzUnLoPUj8G63eaqMClgTQ.text: I have been waiting in anticipation for a very long time to try David Chang's Momofuku restaurant and when I realized there was one in Vegas, I knew I'd have to give it a shot!  The pork bun is every bit as good as promised. The bun is warmed, soft, fluffy and not overwhelming in texture or flavor. The PORK BELLY melts in your freaking mouth. It's perfectly cooked, perfectly seasoned, and just perfect in every way. I wasn't crazy about the sauce it came with. They give you a little bottle in case you want extra. It's kind of like hoisin sauce, but a little thinner and a little sweeter, but in my opinion, you definitely don't need extra. This was SO GOOD.  As for the ramen, it was definitely to 10 ramens I've ever had. The broth was rich and delicious, they give you tons of noodles, and it comes with TWO types of pork. One is a slice of the aforementioned perfection that is the pork belly. They also serve shredded pork shoulder. Honestly, it was a little rich for me, but so good. The bowl isn't that big, so you wouldn't think it was going to be so filling, but I honestly wanted to roll back to my hotel after this bowl of ramen.  My husband got extra mushrooms in his ramen and those were a tasty addition. You can add extra egg or other little things to your ramen, but just get the basics.   Weirdly enough, I think my favorite part about this place was the cider I got, which is from England. It cut the richness of the food just enough, cut the saltiness with the sweetness, and it came with a chilled glass.   The staff were all lovely people as well.  Fun fact: the bathroom has a bidet. lol.

The servers were really nice, but the food was really nothing special the small ramen food chain around China town was way better than this one. 6MllkMFSnDnkLHjJWxlJjw.text: For the prices, one expects a foot-washing, hand rinses, and princely service. Instead, one receives lame jokes from myriad hipster s and bearded "dudes" that couldn't care less if you are there for them or not. Food is overall lame, although is is nicely displayed. Been there, done that, lesson learned. 700.00 (for five) too late. BTW...the noodles were flat, meat was tasteless. Only the buns were worth the cost and hipster "humor." I'd keep walking through the Cosmo, there are much better, less Foo foo places. Then again, if your goal is to merely "be seen at the scene," this place might be just right for the shallow.

r-0Vfkejaxr7rPKnbo2C7w.text: Dinner review. Momofuku.  4 - Hamachi - ponzu, fresno chilies, sorrel 5 - Sichuan ribs - smashed cucumber, chili yogurt 4 - Dry roasted Mussels - Benton's bacon, Momofuku furikake 4 - Spicy Cakes - Sichuan sausage, Chinese broccoli, crispy onion 5 - Black Truffle Ramen - egg yolk, chickpea miso, chive 3 - Chilled Spicy Noodles - Sichuan sausage, Thai basil, candied cashew 4 - Crispy Potatoes - truffle, garlic, creme fraiche  Overall, "as good as it gets."

qxbcqERAgSp5-fp8dTktUQ.text: I was so excited when I heard they were opening. I was even more excited when I finally went. I had heard so many great things about this place so my expectations were pretty high.  We arrived right before dinner rush so we were seated right away and greeted by our server. First impression our server loved being there and it made us love being there too! He was all about the menu and pretty knowledgeable on what was what when suggesting items.   Decor..loved the abstract drawings of the dogs. Our server told us the dogs are actually the owners. That was even more interesting because it made the place seem more personal, hard to do especially since they are located inside the cosmopolitan.   So we started with some appetizers - shishito peppers: can't go wrong with these - crab deviled eggs: have a strong smokey flavor - big eye tuna: OMG one of the best dishes ever! - oysters: small and flavorful my fav  Buns - pork belly: Delicious & the best amongst the buns - shrimp : its breaded, not amongst my favorites  - shitake: very different and glad I tried it  Chilled spicy noodles: spicy so careful. Filled with flavor and surprisingly very good.  Enjoyed a bottle of the Kintaki sake. Highly recommend this! It was so smooth and the taste was so clean.  Overall it was an experience im glad I had. I did feel it was a bit pricey for what it is, noodles and buns, what they are known for.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big eye tuna covered with shaved foie gras. Highly recommend

w45ATfF622aTxt9IVwyp7A.text: Man I had such high hopes for this place. I wasn't able to visit the spot in NY, so I was excited to try this place out. We came around 9, which started great because we didn't have to wait too long to be seated. Our waiter was nice, he was pleasant and gave us our space to enjoy our food. We ordered the ramen and pork buns. The ramen was a decent size, the broth was quite delicious. The broth was subtle with great flavor. The pork was fatty which might have been a bit too fatty because it tasted a bit greasier than i do like. The noodles were just right, although for some reason the bowl itself smelled as though they had burned the noodles. It's the best way to describe which was a bummer because the burning of food smell is always pretty overpowering.   The pork buns were just okay. Again, the pork was a bit more fatty than my liking but overall the presentation was good. I would say they aren't life changing, so it would really be a choice to try. I do not know that I would be interested in trying anything else in the future, especially with so many restaurants in LV.

HUzxs7noyOKEFYdwsK2kuw.text: Sorry, but this place is overhyped.  Since my friends and I were staying at the Cosmo, we thought it'd be nice to eat at Momofuku as our first meal. Our expectations were pretty high, but we ended up leaving super disappointed.   We ordered the pork buns and the pork ramen all around. The pork buns came out first and it was actually pretty good! It was flavorful and the pork was very tender. 2 pork ramen bowls came out and we ordered 5 ramen bowls in total so we waited patiently for the other bowls to come out. We realized that the 3 other bowls were taking awhile so we told our 2 friends to start eating before us. We reminded the servers a couple of times that there were 3 more ramen bowls for the table. We started getting really annoyed because we noticed that tables who ordered after us received their ramen before us. At some point, our server informed us that they accidentally gave away our ramen to a different table lol.. By this point, our 2 friends were basically done with their ramen. I really don't understand why all 5 ramen bowls couldn't come out at the same time.   By the time we received the rest of our orders, we ate our ramen and we felt like the broth was pretty bland. The pork belly was okay but the shredded pork was just so random. It just felt out of the place within the ramen and that also tasted bland as well. Our 2 friends who ate before us tried our broth and realized that our broth tasted different from theirs. I tried their broth and I was shocked that theirs was even MORE bland than mine. It literally tasted like it was watered down. When my friend informed the server, all she replied was, "..Well they came from the same pot, did you want them to make you a new one or something?" My friend declined but we were slightly shocked cause we felt like she thought we were lying, but both batches really did taste different.   I love ramen but this by far was probably the worst ramen I've ever had. Along with horrible ramen, the service wasn't all that great either which made our experience with Momofuku at best only a 2 star rating.

-1CZdOBbJAbJvSgQEVAsLA.text: chickpea ramen was to die for and my boyfriend loved the grilled lamb, very fair prices as well

wgZKK5X5rv5XAaVGBr9nEA.text: Came in before their dinner service started so the menu was pretty limited. We just wanted to try one thing so we went for the pork ramen.  The noodles were cooked just right and it was a good portion. The flavor was also there. There was just wasn't anything special about it. I would come back and eat it again but I feel as though I could just eat the same thing anywhere else.  The layout of the restaurant is nice and you can see into the kitchen. Service was a bit on the slower side and it took forever to get our check.

Ob7buLKbEPU5gcFQdgVtBQ.text: Great unique restaurant. My wife and I loved it. Fun atmosphere but not too loud. We had:  Pear and burrata salad - 5/5 amazing  Oysters - yum!  Scallion and garlic noodles - it was close but this was our favorite dish. So good.   Whole cooked branzino - Delicious. The sauce was outstanding. We really enjoyed picking at it with chopsticks.   It's a great "upscale casual" restaurant. We were there at 730pm in shorts and a decent shirt and felt right at home.   Only complaint is the service was a bit slow at times. Some long pauses between courses and took forever to get the check.

36WczfDUuegIcKcFiV-Hvg.text: Finally got a chance to eat at momo. It was a pretty busy lunch on a sunday (reservations are recommended). We were quickly seated and service was good. Started with the crispy potatoes and the pork buns (best item on the menu!). We had the denver steak, bo ssam rice bowl and the shoyu ramen for entree's. Everything was good, especially the ramen! Service was good but felt a little rushed.   Overall a good experience! Will comeback next time I visit las vegas.

FINncQvdesPYoky_vVYmdA.text: Solid ramen. Not as hype as it was maybe 5-8 years ago but pretty good. Broth is not that fatty but salty and flavorful. Pork belly is amazing and good amount of noodles. Wait can be a little long so sit at the bar if you don't wanna wait for a table!

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shoyu Pork Ramen

-WHUYULz0KpQBKvlOh3xPA.text: Let me preface this review by stating that I am having trouble figuring out how to properly Momofuku.  First, this location is a fusion of all other Momofuku restaurants... They have a little bit of ramen, some noodles, entrees, and even deserts. Instead of one linear focus, the menu here is quite large with a ton of variety!  My wife and I both ordered the pork ramen. 18 dollars and an additional 1 dollar for a small side of chili paste. That price is insane! It was the most expensive bowl of ramen I have ever enjoyed.  Price aside, the ramen was authentic with a very nice broth base and good quality pork.  The question I left with was this... Was the ramen 19 dollars good? Certainly not.  4 stars for the ramen and service, 2 stars for the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

X7C7rp3GAQrrgJnnuBXp1A.text: Everyone has told me to check out Momofuku. We missed them when we were in NY and decided to make a stop while in Vegas. The service was stellar--our waitress Leah was very attentive and knowledgeable with the menu. I definitely regret not getting one of their buns (which they are known for) but it was hard to justify $7 for 1 bun. Instead we started with the shishito peppers which were great and the portion was generous. I got the pork ramen and added shiitake mushrooms and chili oil. Definitely get the chili oil! It adds a nice kick. My boyfriend got the rice bowl which was like a Japanese version of bibimbap. Both were really good! The reason for the 4 stars rather than 5 is that I've had better ramen for cheaper. With all the hype around this place I think my expectations were inflated. Still a very great dining option and it's in the beautiful Cosmopolitan.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shishito peppers, rice bowl, side of chili oil, pork ramen and the jalapeño hef

eJc0qdDBJynOQqlLcoAjwg.text: I'm a big fan of food shows and has always hoped to try out David Chang's Momofuku one day. As you would have expected, I was so excited to finally visit one on my most recent visit to Las Vegas. Now that I have tried it, I felt more like.."ok...been there, done that"...and not like..."yea! I gotta go there again." The experience felt definitely under my expectations..especially when looking at it from the food vs price perspective.  I felt pretty much almost every dish was overpriced. I definitely regretted ordering the soft boiled eggs with salmon roes ($9)...which essentially were literally 2 eggs with salmon roes and light sprinkle of rice crispy and a leaf or two of sprouts on it. Taste wise..not wasn't anything memorable. The buns (chicken karaage and pork belly) that we tried though were quite good..they were really small though...and while I get that the pork belly buns were one of the highlights...charging $6-$7 each is a little ridiculous...I guess it's a result of being in Las Vegas and a signature dish a brand name chef. We also tried the pork belly ramen..and while I get that it's David Chang's interpretation of ramen (made with mushroom based broth?) which differed from traditional ramen, the taste was ok..just wasn't anything memorable...esp given a just ok portion and a price point of $18.  Overall, I think I'm glad I tried it...but I will probably not go there again next time unless someone else in my group wanted to try it. Given the high price point and just ok..not so much memorable taste..and the fact that Las Vegas offers so many great dining options...I would probably choose to go elsewhere next time instead.

nQ1lM3qp5dw7bvWFMkJZ5Q.text: I'm caught in the middle of giving this place 3 or 4 stars but really I feel like the restaurant deserves 3.5. Located in Cosmopolitan on the 2nd floor, prepare for a long walk.   Made reservations ahead of time for a party of 4 and got the Fried Chicken & Caviar, the menu says serves up to 4-6 people but I can imagine it serving even 8. If you do decide to try this make sure you call ahead of time and let them know so they can prepare the order in advance.   The Fried Chicken & Caviar included two chickens that are fried whole, carved, then paired with a choice of Momofuku Reserve caviar, we chose the 8oz Smoked Trout Roe ($328) ... They provide you crepes that you use as a tortilla and truffle creme fraiche to top off. This dish was very intriguing but after some thought I don't feel like it was too amazing.. chicken was cooked well and was moist, and the Truffel creme fraiche was the savior... Put that on top of anything you eat and you got yourself a winner.   We also got some small dishes to balance with the meat:  Bigeye Tuna - shaved foie gras, stone fruit; I would say pass on this, it sounds good but it wasn't to my liking.  Spicy Cucumbers - togarashi, toasted almond; very tasty and full of flavor, it was light and refreshing. Chinese Broccoli - black garlic, ginger; cooked well and tasted good but it's like anything you would typically get at a Chinese restaurant.   I also got a cocktail for myself called Toki Thyme, I really liked the drink! It was well mixed and refreshing to drink throughout dinner.   Final thoughts: Service was okay, our waitress forgot about us a few times. The atmosphere of the venue and view of the Las Vegas strip was cool and chill, especially accompanying hip hop music playing in the background.  The presentation and deliverance of the dishes were great but the food itself was just okay. I feel everything may have been too hyped up and it just fell a bit short for me. Good experience but I wouldn't come back again.

N9_r6vMsKEzBR3VhQ_k4Bw.text: I really wanted to love this place, but was unfortunately underwhelmed by my experience. My friend and I each ordered a pork belly bun, and shared the pork belly ramen.  The pork belly bun was good, but not worth the price point of $7 per bun. I understand that Momofuku is inside The Cosmo and on the Strip of Vegas, but this the type of place I'll visit once and remove from my bookmarks.  The pork belly ramen broth was missing something. I've had my fair share of ramen from restaurants throughout NorCal and SoCal, but didn't find anything special about Momofuku's. We ordered an extra egg, which came on the side - but we did not receive an egg in the actual bowl the ramen came in. I had to flag down our waiter to ask for the egg. After splitting the ramen into two bowls, we had a little bit leftover in the original bowl. A different waiter asked if we were finished and if he could take it, but didn't ask to take the empty plates from the buns we finished. We thought this was odd.   I was so excited to try Momofuku, especially after watching all the Ugly Delicious episodes. 3 stars for the service, ambiance, and decent food.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly buns
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly ramen

zoSQG23hFeYsn2nA4St7Xw.text: The pork buns are so damn good here. At $7 for one it seems expensive but it's a must eat. The buns are done right by being fluffy and soft while the pork inside is tender, salty, fatty. There's hoisin sauce inside but you're given another spicy sauce on the side.  We also got the shoyu pork ramen and the scallion noodles. Coming from California, I've had my decent share of ramen, but the broth here is different. At first taste I thought it was bland but it's probably since I usually get tonkotsu broth which is usually creamy and richer. That being said, I don't mind a lighter tasting broth at Momofuku, it's just different for me since I expected a different depth in the flavor and perhaps saltiness of the broth. The noodles changed the game for me and are very good, as they have a lot of bounce in texture just how I like it. The scallion noodles were ok but refreshing with a lot of cucumbers and sour tasting mushrooms mixed in. I probably should've added some spicy sauce on the side. Overall, I expected more from the noodle bar but the pork buns were awesome. The service was prompt but the prices could be better, but then again it's a popular place. Would come again another time to try something else

LdILQo-MgplIu89DhhjKUg.text: 4.5 / 5 - Pork Bun and Chicken Karage Bun. Oh and make sure you break the yolk in your Pork Ramen.   Momofuku is a great restaurant tucked in the corner of the second floor of the Cosmopolitan. I had high expectations of this place, and for me, it did not disappoint... Now did it live up to my unreasonably high expectations? Probably not, but Momofuku is a restaurant I would eat at again, and again, and again, especially if I'm dealing with a throbbing hangover in Vegas.  Let's start with the buns.  I'm usually a pork bun type of guy, and while the bun was great, the star of the show for me was the Chicken Karage Bun. I'll chalk it up to one of those weekends where having something fried feels better than something braised. The bun's hits you from different angles, but its really the red sauce that completes the dish.  Make sure you add it and don't be shy. 5/5  Moving onto the Ramen, which was a nice gourmet take on your traditional ramen. The roasted pork gave a smoky taste, while the pork belly provided a more sweet and savory taste. It was very complex, yet, the broth didn't blow me away. That was, until I popped the yolk and let it mix with all the flavors in the bowl.  My world changed and this ramen went from 'yeah it's pretty good' to 'damn, I should have did this earlier'.  I have a few ramen joints I like better in LA, but this is a solid choice. I would definitely consider coming here after a night (or day) of partying. 4/5  Service was awesome, and the ambience is a near match for the Cosmo's styling.  The breakdown:  Food: 4.5/5 Service: 5/5 Ambience: 5/5  Dessert at Milk is amazing as well. I'll save that review for another time though, but if you had to get a few things here, make sure it is one of the buns and the dessert from milk.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The famous Pork Bun.
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Karage Bun! A must.
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Ramen. Must break the yolk.

A-Oa8KocWQrFytjT8eeurg.text: In the middle of cosmo hotel. Very crowded, don't forget to make reservation. They were very accommodating in changing our reservation time.  For appetizer we went for: -Pork belly bun, the belly was tender, complements the soft bun. Don't forget to put the sauce, without it, it'll be a bit bland.   -PEI muscle with bacon and caramelized onion. This was such a hit with the table. It was a peppery, smokey bacon and juicy muscle.  -The citrus beet salad was a bit sweet, cold and refreshing appetizer.   Also ordered the pork belly ramen (it wasn't shown on the menu anymore, but super cool of them to  let us to order it). The ramen came with poached egg that were supposed to mix in the ramen to make it creamy. However, I found that the ramen lacks in flavor, it needed some extra salt and chilly.  Overall, excellent service, and considering the location it wasn't a bad place. However the ramen itself was a bit of a let down.

I4q0foMRa152ANdQJ-5T1Q.text: The entire staff really knew what they were doing, and it showed with how easy the flow was from the moment we stepped in, until some thirty minutes when we left.  We dropped in for a quick meal/snack.  Their chilled noodle was surprisingly good.  It tasted mostly of basil with a kick.  I think even if you aren't too health conscious, it's a dish that can still be enjoyed.  Of course, get the chasu buns (the shrimp was good too).  I can't attest to a longer dining experience with tons of dishes, but stepping in for a quick meal is definitely a possibility!

BSxmDb7GzZS0m5CTBhxv3w.text: My first time and definitely not my last time..the food, the service it was busy for a Tuesday night...lucky we had reservations,the restaurant itself is located on the 2nd floor of the hotel casino area..the food tasted really good, the big eye tune w/ shaved foie gas and strawberries simply yet tasty..the black truffle ramen was out of this world, they even slip the ramen in half for us to share.. even gave us both egg yolks, the toasted seafood noodle was spicy and really good...are roasted mussels took a while but we were comped the mussels and alcohol drinks... Then........ there was crack pie, omg so tasty but what's makes crack pie even better??? Free soft serve crack pie and chocolate soft serve all from milkbomb, David Chang's other business...check out momofuku for the drinks and the food

sxPQueDcmTljX4e4GvKpUA.text: To me, Momofuku is the typical Las Vegas over-hyped restaurant. Very small portions for insane prices. I mean pickled vegetable for $15? What has the chef been smoking to charge these prices?   We had the bite-size, $14 buns (Pork Belly - hoisin, scallion, cucumber). They lacked sauce, crunch and left us wondering again about the mental state of the chef. Their noodle bowls again seem small for the price and not much to crave for.   I say if you're coming from the part of the country that doesn't have picked veggies or noodles and you're stuck at Costmo and can't walk anywhere (maybe broken legs and hands) and are dying of hunger, then spend some money at this place. Otherwise, there're plenty of better places.

8IW-1CaXTvQvZYg5aQAA5w.text: Love this restaurant. We decided to give this place a try after watching David Chang on the show " ugly delicious."  Food - we ordered the mussels with bacon, Kim chi, cucumbers ( must try ) and the duck platter.  It's a shame that we didn't take any pictures. We just ate the food. Boo !!!

iIG4zpNtHYwkRrSnOc-MEw.text: Amazing dining experience. Upon checking in for our reservation, the service was absolutely excellent. Our server was knowledgeable, made sure we got the most for our money and hilarious. We ordered the chicken karaage with caviar, eggplant, lobster & shrimp, pork chops, wedge less wedge salad, rice cakes and pork buns. My favorites were the chicken karaage, eggplant, lobster & shrimp and pork buns. All paired with some delicious kimchi and some amazing sauce they gave us for the pork buns (but that I used on 75% of my meal). We also ordered a really great sake. I found the pork a little dry and the wedge salad was unremarkable but I really enjoyed the meal overall and the service really brought it to the next level. This should be a must visit when in Vegas or New York.

We had the Chilled Spicy Noodles, Ginger Scallion Noodles (we really like noodles!), and all were super delicious. Service was excellent. For dessert go next door to Milk Bar.

Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilled Spicy Noodles, Ginger Scallion Noodles, Fried Brussels Sprouts and Cauliflower

KDwDEwWhkJN1GlBhbGmCLA.text: Momofuku is located inside the Cosmo and right next to the Milk Bar which I will be reviewing as well! First of all, the interior decor is on point - definitely the most beautiful ramen restaurant I have ever been to. With that said, sometimes I find that the more beautiful the restaurant (excluding fine dining), the less tasty the food. This is no exception.  The pork ramen was by no means bad, but it was not wheorth the hefty price tag. The noodles were decent, the broth wasn't very flavorful and the egg was mediocre. The best part of this dish was the pork itself which was tender and delicious. That was what saved the dish.   Service was great, the food not so much. Probably wouldn't come back here.

pS7c2IytfYEx3tTfkWMF-w.text: We came here with a large group of friends on an annual couples' getaway. This was our first night in Vegas.  The service was impeccable. Beautiful setting in the back. Elevated dining room with a view and very cozy (not like the front of the restaurant). Our waitress asked if we would be interested in family style dining, with the chef's selections. One of our friends is allergic to oysters and we told her that was our only dietary restriction. They started bringing out one amazing dish after another, every single one selected by the restaurant chef not any one of the diners in our group. We were blown away by the presentation, service, variety of the dishes, taste... everything! Wow, you guys impressed all of us. Thank you for a wonderful start to a fun weekend!

yhEmiBrgbt24rcaoTGZFXg.text: I have to agree with Michael T; it's always hard to review an Asian (fusion) spot when you've been to a lot of Asian restaurant and are familiar with the food.  And to be perfectly honest, I did not have too high expectations considering is 1. a well-known chain from New York City (NEW YORK CITY! ), and 2. right in the middle of the Las Vegas Strip (and in the Cosmopolitan nonetheless).   But Momofuku did prove me wrong.  We went on a Saturday for lunch and while the menu was limited, we tried enough to have our bellies satisfied.  Keeping it simple:  Pros: - gorgeous, spacious ambience; - they accommodated our party of 8 right away with no wait time; - the baos - I've had my share of baos and the pork belly bao was simple and good - CHICK PEA RAMEN -- finally, something different from the regular ramen!  And we're not just talking regular boiled chick peas, but crispy (likely flash-fried) chickpeas. What a delicious and original surprise, and the broth and noodles were delicious. I can still taste it now. - Dessert - I had already planned to go to Milk Ice Cream Bar next door and since it's from the same owner, we were able to have our ice cream in the restaurant, which was perfect! I had the crack ice cream and while it was delicious, it could have used a little crispiness to go with the soft serve.  Cons: - none that I can think of...$18 for a bowl of Ramen seems a bit steep but let's remember that you are in Las Vegas - wish that some of the dinner menu were offered during the daytime  Otherwise - I was pretty impressed, and now I know where to get a great bowl of Ramen in Vegas!

rdT4CO4Iaapj3NV8P80dBg.text: We came here for lunch around noon but the line wasn't too bad, only about 10 minutes.   The place looks nice and very clean. Our waiter, tall lean asian guy, was super nice and thoughtful. Food comes pretty fast.   We got the Bo Sa'm bowl (pork shoulder fried rice with kim chi sauce, $17), Pork Belly ramen bowl ($17), pork belly bun ($7); I guess we had a theme going. I liked the pork belly bun and bo sa'm bowl, but I thought the pork belly ramen bowl was just so-so in terms of the broth. The noodle was good though. I thought the food was overpriced and did not blow me away.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iHAk_sMOnIb2tEYfeDTXhA.text: I have been obsessed with David Chang lately as I have been watching his Netflix show, Ugly Delicious. My sister and I excitedly made reservations at Momofuku during our trip to Vegas. However, I was a bit disappointed with the food. We ordered the short rib kimchi stew, the pork belly buns, and ginger scallion noodles. I can totally see non-Koreans being impressed by the "unique" flavors, but to me, It just tasted like hipster Korean fusion. The food is definitely catered to the non-Asian palette. However, I was impressed with the level of service and efficiency. The food arrived promptly and my water glass was refilled so many times, I was the most hydrated I've ever been in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kimchi short rib stew
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ginger Scallion Noodles
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Porky Pork Belly Buns

vCU27vF5BwdNnIln0eK3EA.text: Momofuku has been around for a while now but I never got the chance to try it until recently. I very much enjoyed my experience at Major Domo in Los Angeles and was hoping for the same here at Momofuku. Located in the Cosmopolitan hotel in Las Vegas, the restaurant is beautiful, modern and airy.   We came here for lunch and were luckily seated right away, having just beaten the first lunch rush. Since this place was known for their buns, we all ordered our own Pork Belly Buns which came with hoisin sauce, scallions and cucumbers. Honestly, while tasty for what it was as expected, I'm not sure if I could justify spending $7 for just one bun. If you don't live in an area where buns are easily accessible, then give it a try but if buns are a popular "it" food in cities like LA, you could probably find the same thing for less that's just as good.   Now the Bo Sssam Rice Bowl sealed the deal for me. Glazed pork shoulder, kimchi rice and pickles put together is seriously one awesome flavor bomb. The pork shoulder was fall-apart tender and the kimchi rice was seriously addicting. The pickled vegetables were sweet, crunchy and vinegary. The perfect accompaniment to round off all the strong, heavy flavors. Although the bowl looked sort of small, it was actually quite deep and all of us who ordered it found ourselves with plenty of leftovers to bring back.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Belly Bun
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bo Ssam Rice Bowl

0wCA0kYFk6WWEBgRCvmWgw.text: This place deserves 10 stars!! We came in for lunch and got seated really quickly. I thought there would be a wait since it's in Cosmo and already has so many good reviews. We came in with a group of 8 and only waited 5 minutes.  I ordered the pork belly bun as an appetizer and the Shoyu Pork Ramen as my entree. The pork belly bun was so good!! The best I've ever had. The meat was really juicy and delicious. The extra hot sauce made it even better too! The ramen was also really good. They were really generous with their meat.  Service was great as well. Employees were very friendly and accommodating.  This is probably my favorite restaurant in Vegas. I'd definitely come back when I visit!!

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shoyu Pork Ramen
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Cucumbers

6ZPSMy01nfDiZ9Jq_nqfIg.text: Our daughter was in town an choose Momofuku for dinner ~ very glad she did as we most likely would never have tried it!     Very Asian type food with a twist ~ EVERY dish was a WINNER from the sweet & sour long beans, ham & biscuits, fois, hot or cold noodles etc. All the plates are shareable so that's a Gr8 way to taste lots of choices.      Lovely and exotic drink menu if your daring, also they do offer traditional cocktails also. I had the milk cherry  punch and it was nothing like I expected....DEEELISSSH so I ordered another .      Our server Josh, certainly enhanced our dinner experience ~ extremely helpful, knew the menu offered suggestions and just pleasantly conversational.      Would NOT HESITATE TO RETURN to MOMOFUKU in the Cosmopolitan .... ask for Josh

GhwedDTDSMN9Shb83a6PRg.text: It's every bit delicious and imaginative as I remember after seeing David Chang detail Momofuku on his television shows.   The Pork Belly Bun: the meaty, fatty piece of pork belly is tender and melt in your mouth. Proportionally, it's super filling and rich so do come hungry. The light steamed bun, crisp cucumbers and specialty sauce that you can add helps to cut the richness. I devoured it all.   Pork Belly Slow Roasted Pork Shoulder Ramen: ramen isn't listed on their menu, but a server is more than happy to let you know what is available. I loved the broth, and I remember seeing on David Chang's how he creates his ramen broth. I'm not sure if it was the same broth I saw on tv but I can taste the love and care that went into it. Paired with a melt in your mouth chunk of pork belly, slow roasted pork shoulder, and a poached egg whose center was incredibly orange - it's ramen at its finest.   I'm glad I was able to dine here.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly and slow roasted pork shoulder ramen. Delicious!
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deliciously tender and crisp pork belly bun.

Xamt5ZslPHgDn6rOdd4Tpg.text: Perhaps I walked into this place with too high expectations from watching Ugly Deliciousness & Mind of a Chef. This pork ramen does not live up to its $17 price tag.  I have had a lot of delicious ramen recently.   Let's breakdown the ramen. Overall, the momofuku ramen is certainly below par. The only saving grace are the chewy Sun Brand noodles and the perfectly poached egg. The shoyu broth is on the Japanese authentic salty side but lacks the umami-ness of a 12 hr broth. The chopped pork shoulders reminds me of a bad southern barbecue. It lacks seasoning. The pork belly was good but difficult to eat in one bite.   All together, I feel like you'll be paying for all the marketing of David Chang and not for the food itself. With so many other choices in the area, this will be a one & done experience for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shoyu Pork Ramen

W9hWozrMJ1XAWl6mrtd1zg.text: Dave Chang's Vegas restaurant lived up to the hype and then some for me. I've visited twice but have yet to try their pricier large-format menu items, with combinations like fried chicken and caviar or salt and pepper lobster and shrimp- maybe someday! That said, a recent weekend walkup lunch for two was great and our total was less than we'd expected for the quality of our meal.  I've genuinely enjoyed almost everything I've had here, from the lamb ribs (so gamey, great sauce!) to the bossam (share with a friend!), and sides like garlic noodles (simple but so good). Their bao are sold in single-orders for ~$7, and I preferred the chicken over the pork belly.  I have not yet tried the chirashi (priced at a cool $42) or the ramen, but this is on my short list of places I recommend regularly to friends coming to Vegas specifically for food.   NOTE: There's a limited "afternoon" menu (daily, 3-5:30PM) and late night bar menu (11PM-midnight). Pop next door for dessert at MilkBar afterward.

3qTUDUtmYE2bjDKB1_XkBA.text: If you are in Vegas and you are a foodie you must must must go it is an incredible meal it is one of the best fusion meals ever made in this world!! The experience is amazing the staff is wonderful! I am from LA and we get great food there but I will say this is next level stuff they are doing over here!!! They also just debuted their dessert menu and we were the first ones to try the sundae! Wow ! Every bite a celebrato

sf0Kt9zuFdflPC8xEtZcTA.text: This was a wonderful place to get a reservation to, even if it was a lunch on a Tuesday. Got to experience the chicken katsu and caviar dish and sampled some bites off my girlfriend's ramen. All delicious and pricy! I have a small goal to try and actually pre-order for fried chicken and caviar if I come here next time with some dessert. Hadley is the best server I have had the pleasure of meeting in my years of Las Vegas trips with friends or family and he made my first visit here great to where I want to come back later this year! He was the most caring and accommodating server I have also met too. Momofuku is a great place and I definitely recommend it!

zqEHhYs8gsRjqtxzF3MwGQ.text: Tucked inside the Cosmopolitan, Momofuku Las Vegas is a flavorful ride. If you make a reservation, you'll get to sit inside of the dining room and avoid the high top tables.  I wish I remembered our waiter's name - he was warm and full of good recommendations, chatty and personable. There was also a young man whose main job seemed to be setting up the table settings, refilling water, and very silently sliding a fork and knife next to people who he thought needed it (there were only chopsticks on the original table setting).  We started with an order of pork belly buns, which come two per order ($14) with pork belly, hoisin sauce, pickled cucumber, and scallions tucked into a pretty standard bao. I would have liked the cucumbers to be a bit more crunchy, but the pork belly itself was tasty. The bao was not my favorite I've ever had - a bit soggy for my taste.  My partner got the grilled striped bass ($28), which came with kimchi butter, mushrooms, and snow peas. The kimchi butter was pretty tasteless, but the skin was crispy perfection and salty.  That didn't stop him for stealing glances (and bites) of my dish - the bo ssam bowl ($17), with glazed pork shoulder, kimchi rice, and various pickles. I added an egg for $2, and that made all the difference - big thank you to my waiter for recommending it! The pork shoulder was a little too sweet, the cucumbers a little too thin, but everything mixed together made for bite after perfect bite. This was a fantastic lunch.  Add in a quick stop at Milk Bar afterwards, and you have all the ingredients for a perfect meal!

Ge6-CMUhzBjNEHEWLTjIrg.text: It's Netflix fault why we are here! We've been seeing David Chang in almost every food docu series in it and definitely checked Yelp for his restaurant reviews.  They didn't disappoint us I must say!  We ordered Shoulder braised pork (together with the rice, sides, oysters) and Pork Bun, Chicken Karage. It's only 4 of us but we're so full we have to take the rest for to go!  Pork Bun and Chicken Karage is wow!!!  Shoulder braised pork is phenomenal!  Service was great too! David Chang must thank his people for a job well done! They're totally doing their job with passion.  So why 4 stars?  Menu was a bit skeptical for me. You'll see ramen here on Yelp yet their Dinner menu (which we had by the way) isn't even there. I guess they have it but only for ramen bar seating. My bad that i didn't also even bothered to ask them but so far in all.. It's 4 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s Netflix&#39;s fault why we are here! Been seeing David Chang in almost every food series lately. So glad we tried his bad azz menu!

LGiVIA6_Bc7oS_WuSjREIg.text: The infamous chef David Chang with a few Michelin Stars under his belt, now at his ever-popular Momofuku restaurant on level 2 at the Cosmopolitan Hotel Las Vegas!   Beautiful and gracious hostesses, they were so welcome and we didn't even have a reservation but the bar would do it for us!  Watching chefs and line cook whipping up dishes with this open bar is priceless. Everything was clean, transparency, and love watching them executed each dish over and over again!  The Pork Chop Tomahawk with watercress was spot on, for under $50, it's a bargain and plenty to share for 2-3 people. That way you can try more dishes! That's how we dine out ;-)  The Spicy Cucumber Salad, togarashi, toasted almond, it was just perfect, not spicy at all.   Ginger Scallion Noodles, pickled shiitake, spicy cucumber, wakame was really good, on a slighter saltier side though.  Pork Belly Bun, hoisin, scallion, cucumber was PERFECT.  Mushroom Bun was a substitution for a colleague of mine do not eat pork! Unfortunately, this was overly salty! We appreciated our server Manny, he was spot on and very accommodating with us! Congrats on being a new dad!   Black Truffle Ramen, egg yolk, chive,   $50, generous freshly shaved black truffle, very well balanced broth. If you know me. I order truffle anywhere I go if it's FRESH!  This was my very 1st time to try fresh black truffle over ramen! And I really liked it!  They have awesome Large Format dishes. To share if you have a group of 4 or more! Unless you are a fat ass like me, you order everythang on the menu and just take home later, HA! So my hotel room all stinky up the next day! But it's perfect for hang over! You know what I mean!   5 Spice Roasted Duck at $238, the whole rotisserie duck served with the leg confit over rice, bibb lettuce, chive pancakes, kimchi, hoisin, ssam sauce, ginger scallion sauce and fresh herbs.   This is the second most expensive duck in vegas, beside Hakkasan Caviar Duck Service! But it was good enough with all the goodies!  We will come back just for our server Manny & the Pork Belly Bun & the Truffle Ramen of course!  Menu changes so often here so it's a good thing!

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

XnHYMnb-qiahLZz1h0xmaQ.text: Amazing!!   Food: order everything if possible. Everything has a unique taste. We ordered the ramen and buns. Highly recommend the following:   - pork belly bun  - shrimp bun  - ginger scallion noodles (this is dry, no soup)  - shoyu pork ramen   The shoyu pork ramen was a bit bland. It just tasted like soy sauce. The portions are big and satisfying so don't be skeptical of the prices, afterall we are in Vegas. It's either $17 ramen or buffets.

cuuhwzHc2KFgE3p7xptofw.text: Pretty dang overpriced for what you get. Everything was reaaaaaaalllllyyyyyyy salty!!!! So salty I felt sick and couldn't finish my food. Won't come back.

GoYBvaYo-_w09-0ixQTLrQ.text: The BEST!!! The pork belly bun is incredibly juicy and tender. Lamb rib is so flavorful and Sichuan noodle is just amazing amazing!!

dLMYg9s8VrxJuTJHLROVtg.text: One of the best eating experiences of my life.  I'm ashamed to admit I am a bandwagoner... I hadn't really heard about Momofuku until I watched David Chang's show Ugly Delicious.  Damn am I glad I found out about this.  We were in Vegas for a friends bachelorette, and despite all of the fun clubs and nights out, going to Momofuku was the highlight of the trip for many of us.  We ate family style and ordered many things to share.  Every single thing was mind blowing and delicious.  This is next level eating.  I expected everything to be very small portions since it is such a fancy restaurant, but everything was the perfect size.   1. Pork belly buns- huge, meaty and so tasty. One of the highlights. 2. Spicy cucumbers- I am not a huge cucumber fan, but these were delicious with the seasoning and a great light starter. 3. Ginger scallion noodles-  The chili garlic noodles are probably more of a palette pleaser for me, but these were perfect.  The temperature, the textures all together.  A great flavor combination between the ginger, seaweed, and mushrooms. 4. Hozon rice cakes- my absolute favorite.  They were lightly fried and just barely crispy on the outside.  The sauce they were drenched in was absolute perfection 5. Hertiage pork tomahawk-  The most delicious dry rubbed bbq pork you could imagine.  It was beautiful with figs and peaches on top.    I can't even begin to describe the flavors all of these had- it was really a one of a kind experience that everyone should have!

wlFOiBEUxdHbNGxjZnh27g.text: We visited this place on July 1st 2019.  We ordered the Ramen pork-belly noodles and some pork-belly sandwich.  The ramen caused about $18 per bowl. It's nothing like the ramen I had in NYC.  Broth is way too light and does not taste anything near to a Japanese ramen broth. Nothing special about it.  Japanese ramen broth I had in NYC is much better than this place.  Service is definitely great but I am here for the quality of the food.   Lunch menu for price is a above average with an average taste.  Dinner menu is overpriced.

6lufS6fw2gNYnKCWXaIiBA.text: Got the cold pesto pasta with shrimp which was great. Hope to come back and try other items

wwzF_mrBeRps9knfN-hIBA.text: Located inside the Cosmopolitan, the aesthetic and vibe of this place gives you a sense of relaxation from the crowd outside. My recommendation is to try the pork belly buns. The cut is fatty and crispy but soft so you're able to enjoy a bigger bite in order to get a taste of the pickles and bun too; it's a definite must try in addition to your main course order. I ordered the Bo Saam and it was really flavorful as well. The radishes and savory meet had a good balance, not to mention it's very filling as well!

j5q4KVFt2VzpoHXMyt9rpg.text: Great service.  Accommodated my kids' palate.  Best experience seated in front of the chefs at the counter.

ZJ4gCkDpm_T-kNBthiBZcg.text: Amazing & unique food! We made reservations on open table and came for dinner on a Thursday evening. Glad we made reservations because the restaurant was pretty full when we arrived!   I am a big fan of ugly delicious and wanted to try David Chang's food. We ordered a variety of food to try. My favorites were the lamb ribs, Brussels sprouts, and crack pie. The lamb ribs had a white sauce that was delicious and perfect. The Brussels sprouts and broccoli had a mildly spicy fish sauce seasoning that I really enjoyed as well. The pork belly in the pork bun was very tender and you can dip it in their house sauce. I wouldn't recommend the pork ramen because it tastes very ordinary and you can get it elsewhere for much cheaper than $17. The crack pie is also a must try if you have room for dessert. You are also allowed to order any of the treats from milk bar next door to eat at the dinner table.   There is a fee to park at cosmopolitan so we parked at planet Hollywood for free and walked across the bridge to cosmo to save money :)

QY1qlC92oZlWkDNIh_kqlQ.text: Delicous!!!!!!!  Great food, wonderful staff & impressive cocktails!  Loved it!!   We sat at the counter by the kitchen.  Even the chefs were fun & pleasant!

aLWK3UBzORkCuGTvwgmVhg.text: Quite pricey but overall the food was good.   Chilled spicy noodles was a great surprising dish. The Thai basil pesto made the dish really tasty. Noodles had a nice chew. The candied cashews gave it a nice crunch. Sausage and peppers gave it a little bit of kick.   Bao bun was good but for $7 was more of a one time thing. Ssam sauce went well with it. Bun wasn't dry and was soft. Pork nice and tender.   Hamachi appetizer was pretty good. Fish was fresh and bacon ponzu was interesting. $20+ for about six slices.   Old fashioned was well made. Slightly smokey but smooth overall.
