Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp buns &amp; pork belly buns (look at how colossal that pork belly is!)

FNgtAHPasGNBaD_vNalWWw.text: We dropped in just before five. The main dining room opens at 5:30 so we needed no reservations. The music is very very loud but it is Las Vegas. I ordered the shrimp appetizer from the bar menu thinking there would be the usually 4 tiny grilled shrimp. Nope , a beautiful array of fried ( hadn't planned on that ooops but yummy) shrimp , mildly hot peppers and scallions arrived. It was amazing. My friend had the chick pea ramen noodles. She really enjoyed her meal. We skipped dessert but my impression is there are a lot of devastatingly good cookies here.

Yv_lB8fqWHqjaqjyiF27ww.text: Never in my life have I eaten such creative and divine Japanese food. The vibe of this place is very modern while blending in Japanese style. The menu is full of options to take your palette on a journey you won't regret. The wife and I both chose the Sichuan beef noodles, which was the right decision. I couldn't quite find the right way to describe it, but it kind of reminded me of Japanese spaghetti. And let me tell you, I'd choose this meal every day for the rest of my life if I had to. The spices were a complex melody of love, cooked perfectly with the meat and layered on top of a bed of beautiful noodles. No other pasta-based dish will come close to this, and I don't want to eat anything else.

AklvaNf58-iy9quZnUMFeA.text: I loved the Netflix show Ugly Delicious, and didn't realize that Momofuku had a spot in the Cosmo.  When I realized where my friends had dragged me for dinner, I was stoked!   At first look of the menu, my jaw dropped. $50 for a darn plate of salmon?!? Holy Cannoli! Hard pass.  The menu was very pricey, with the exception of noodles. As a girl who likes to do Vegas on a somewhat reasonable budget, I got the ginger scallion noodles for $15.   I was worried that the dish would be too small, given the lower price point compared to the rest of the menu items. To my surprise, it was a perfectly sized dish (I was unable to finish the bowl. Most of my friends devoured their bowls, and we were all very full and happy afterwards).   The Ginger Scallion Noodles came in a bowl with a big lump of thick and perfectly cooked noodles, some incredibly tasty mushrooms, seasoned seaweed, of course...scallions, etc. For such a simple plate, the flavors merged together very nicely to make a delicious noodle dish.   Hint: Make sure you specify tap water when ordering or they will pour you some fancy bottled water and surprise you with some charges on the bill!

ABSLdkd0RmPiH16ZKK_tCw.text: I was in town for a conference staying at The Cosmo and I noticed that there was a Momofuku.  Living in NYC, I'm a big fan of Momofuku so my colleague and I went for dinner on our second night.  It's a very large restaurant and has a great aesthetic.  It was packed out and that was to be expected.  We were seated at the bar and were helped right away.  The tab was on the job...so we ordered quite a bit. My colleague was a little more experienced with the menu so he ordered for the two of us and we basically shared everything.  The Pork chop was my absolute favorite.  Flavorful and really hit the spot after a long day of walking around Vegas.  Went really well with the Long Beans.  The noodles to me were a little strange but definitely not bad.  If I remember correctly, they had a little kick to them so make sure you're ok with spicy food.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet &amp; Sour Long Beans
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Chop
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. If I remember correctly...these are the Sichuan Beef Noodles.  Feel free to correct me.

lSTJ8ErzNQ-XkOCMkvkBBw.text: I enjoyed my dinner experience at Momofuku but nothing I had was exceptional other than the price.  On entry Momofuku feels like a slightly more tasteful version of lots of other hip Asian cuisine restaurants you've been in for the last decade: street vibes, street painting, 90's era hip-hop and breakbeats; DJ Shadow and Jurassic 5 must make a fortune off royalties from these places.  Normally I'm not too concerned with price but it's hard not to notice kimchi short rib stew for 48 US dollars. I love this soup but damn, this had better be the best soup I've had in my entire life. Seemingly more appropriate was the Bo Ssam - even though it was around 168 my assumption was that this was going to be a massive amount of food (and it lived up to expectations!)  Our table tried some of the pork buns. These were O.K. There was definitely a generous amount of pork belly in each but the flavor was pretty flat. This began the first of many applications of the Ssam sauce which was both delicious and essential for most of what we ate.  Next up was the Kimchi Stew. This was the star of the show and for a moment made me forget that I'd paid nearly 50 bucks for stew. The short rib itself was O.K. but really the special thing about this was the combination of the perfect kimchi stew flavor with cheesy, gooey burrata - turns out this was much better than just dropping an American cheese slice in there.  The Ssam was huge and probably more than we should have ordered.  But that hugeness didn't come with huge flavor and I found this dish more than the others really required generous helpings of the Ssam sauce. I felt like I was doing the equivalent of liberally dousing a steak with A1 because the meat itself wasn't that special.   Overall I'm not too excited to return here for dinner even though the vibe was quite nice and the service was very good. Maybe I'll try the lunch?

ZctLI7nYOllN70jicp1njQ.text: The overall taste for most of the dishes were flavorful. However, the lobster was a tad too salty for us. The tempura shrimp was very crunchy and perfectly seasoned. The ceviche canape and Shishito peppers were the best dishes. They forgot to switch on the lights at the group dining until we requested for it. Kind of odd. It was also too pricey based on overall quality of the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salt and Pepper Lobster &amp; Shrimp
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kampachi Ceviche
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Market Oysters

8wUrupA-RLdiav1d8-8cuA.text: Highly recommend - probably one of my favorite restaurants...ever.  I went to Momofuku on my first night in Vegas on my most recent trip and sat at the noodle counter. It was a Thursday evening and I had no trouble getting a seat quickly. I'm glad I sat at the noodle bar because I was by myself and enjoyed watching the kitchen work.  I started with the serrano peppers and had the black truffle ramen for dinner. The peppers. WOW. So delicious - and so simple! I can't believe they are as good as they are. I was also so so happy that I was able to eat the peppers. I have a severe shellfish allergy and often can't have fried food because the food either goes in the same frier as shrimp, or the friers are too close together. I told them about my allergy and they used a special frier just for those people who have allergies! It was so cool that the restaurant thought through something like allergies.  When the black truffle ramen arrived I thought it looked beautiful and the smell - amazing! but then I took a bite. I was floored. Easily the best bowl of ramen I have had (and absolutely worth the $$$). Am I allowed to say I almost got teary eyed over this ramen??? well, i kept it together, but only just. It is a must try and I can't wait to have that bowl again.  I was so blown away that I returned to momofuku two more times on my weekend trip. I got the chick pea ramen (twice) and the cucumber appetizer (once). The chick pea ramen was so so good! and vegetarian! I was so surprised at how flavorful it was. I could easily eat that daily. The cucumbers were also very very good. They were fresh and sliced thinly and tossed in a spicy (ish) sauce/seasoning. I'm looking forward to my next trip to Vegas (or New York) to eat at momofuku again.  I also got the crack pie (which comes from milk bar next door) for dessert one of my visits here. I ordered it with the cereal milk ice cream. The pie was amazing. The ice cream, I was take it or leave it on. Maybe if I was less full I would have enjoyed it more, but I was so stuffed from dinner that I prioritized the pie.  Overall, I don't think I can give a higher recommendation than the one I give for momofuku - you must eat here.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chickpea Ramen - absolutely delicious
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crack pie with ice cream - crack pie was amazing, I was so full I could barely eat the ice cream
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Serrano peppers - spicy and delicious!

3pMW8-Uga8LWbREdwp3Z5g.text: Stopped in for a quick lunch.  Menu was limited but with protuberance add ons to the ramen it was filling.  I had the chick pea ramen.  He chickpeas were crispy and added a nice texture to the soup.  The noodles were tender.  I wish there were more vegetables in the bowl.  It had bok Choy but I would have liked more.  The broth is a warm smoky spice and added veggies would have given it some variation.  I also had the shishito peppers as an appetizer.  They had a hint of lime and were very good.  The drink I had was a Jalapeno honey infused concoction that had a good bit of heat.  The taste reminded me of tequila but there was none in it.  This was very good but if you don't like spice it's not for you.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XDOr5XAkGaO0JF6tdjUPZg.text: We stopped by on Saturday (9/15) just before 5pm and we were seated right away as it wasn't busy. Never having been to a David Chang restaurant, we were all excited.  Not having much time to stay and try everything, we kept it simple and just ordered the Shoyu Pork ramen and Pork Belly buns. This was the most tender, buttery pork belly I've ever had, that we ended up ordering seconds. Of course, try everything with the spicy sauce! If you have room for dessert, you can choose from a short Milk Bar "fan favorites" menu, or just head over next door to order at Milk Bar directly for the full menu options.  I would love to visit again to try the dinner menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Belly bun
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shoyu Pork Ramen

u6K-NbqmXIBSmqaF2TspOQ.text: Momofuku has been on my list for sometime, especially after watching Ugly Delicious. Major respect for David Chang!   I read lots of mixed reviews around this restaurant and but that didn't keep me away. I was too curious and I'll just say I wasn't disappointed. I do think that people have hyped this place up a lot. That can easily change your view on a place.  I loved the take on his cuisine and how it was presented. The food was rich and felt inviting with each bite. Every bite got better and better throughout my meal. I started off with the pork bun.  I love pork bao in general. This pork belly bun was just so flavorful yet simplistic. I used the Korean chili sauce in everything to spice it up and I want that sauce for myself to have at home!   My shoyu pork ramen was also delicious and very flavorful. Things are a bit more simplistic than other ramens I've had. This was nice and clean broth with tons of pork. The noodles were cooked perfectly and that egg yolk...so much yes! Yolky is the way to go in ramen for me.   The pork was the spotlight for me. The only thing that was a little less than desired was the beans. They seemed to be overcooked and less fresh. The presentation on that dish could be much better.   Overall, I was pleasantly surprised and would come back. Especially for the buns!

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet and sour long beans
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork bun

HlJHGsVQqzEtNl0t7XGX-Q.text: This place could be cheap and expensive, depends on what you order. Single ramen is like 15ish dollars. But I chose to add the truffle, it cost 50 dollars more. I have to admit the broth with truffle in it tasted very rich and great - it did feel a little bit heavy though. I would really like to try those huge dishes like lobster stuffs- but these are for large group of people. The pork bun tasted ok, I didn't feel that special. They sometimes have hidden menu depends on the season - you really need to ask the waiter and you might get a surprise :)

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle ramen!!

qGUych6FFH3GNngpJpczsw.text: Food: ordered the chicken, pork buns, chili noodles and garlic noodles Service: excellent, very responsive and kind Presentation: good not great Ambiance: excellent for dates and small groups Conclusion: it was good not great, for the amount of money and you spend you may be disappointed. I recommend going next door to Block 16 where you can get something from each place and still not spend as much as the chicken. But if u do go... Def try the pork tacos, I know they don't call them tacos but that's what they are   Eat on!

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aYH5AFsTH5lU1ks81q1f4g.text: I took my family to here for dinner. This is one of the  places on my list that I wanted to try.  Things I loved: -The staff was great. The server was friendly and attentive. And rest of the staff was excellent; they refilled our water promptly, refreshed plates, also refreshed napkins when my son's napkin got a little messy. -All the proteins were perfectly cooked. We had steak, pork belly, cod, and chicken. All of them were moist and tender or buttery.  Things I liked: -Miso Black Cod: the fish was moist, buttery and melt in my mouth. The bok choy was pretty good, it soaked up the broth. -Whole Jidori chicken: big flavor seasoning on the chicken with a little crunchiness outside. The whole chicken was very tender and moist, even the white meat was moist. The Kimchi was tasty. -Australian Wagyu Steak: the meat was perfectly cook very tender. Our server suggested to eat the dish like a lettuce wrap. The flavor was good and tasted better eating all of the ingredients all at once in the wrap. And the rice was fine. -Pork Ramen: the noodle was good, nice firm texture, and the broth was solid. The pork was soft and tender. It was different that the bowl came with slide pork and shredded pork. -Pork Belly Bun: it served with a big piece of pork belly. The pork was a little crispy outside and very tender when bit into the meat. Flavor wise was fine, similar to many other pork belly buns I had in the past.  Thing that just okay: -Oyster: the oysters were just okay, definitely I had many better ones before, but the smoked trout roe in the sauce was good.  Overall I was a little disappointed. I had high expectations. I didn't have a bad dish, but didn't have any amazing dish neither.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. December 2018
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Ramen
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Whole Jidori Chicken

ci-vJjF6HwerPtX9q9Idag.text: Food was a 9.4- really incredible, rice cake dish was the highlight followed closely by the sweet potatoes.   Service was a mess - 5. -  arrived for an 8 pm reservation on time yet table wasn't ready for another 20 minutes.  Upon being sat we didn't see a member of the waitstaff for 20 minutes.  Service throughout dinner was choppy at best.    We'd go back in a heartbeat, but the service didn't live up to the food tonight.

HdPyYS0HmA6dhlS_yjrgkQ.text: I was totally expecting more out of momofuku.  It was ok but it did not blow me away.   I'm sure if I went to the New York location it would have been a totally better experience   My service was very good.  The restaurant had a great feel to it.  I had a fantastic seat at the Kitchen bar.   My first dish was big eye tuna with strawberries and shaved foie gra.  This first plate was outstanding.  Best dish I ordered.    Second plate was a Burrata and black truffle with black kale salad with sourdough.   At first all I saw was kale.  But under the pile of kale was the Burrata and I'm assuming truffle oil.  I kinda decided to toss my salad with what little Burrata there was   My main was a cedar planked salmon with sunflower risotto and tamp-era corn kernels.   The best part of the plate was everything except the salmon.   I felt it was over cooked and a bit dry.   Dessert I ordered crack cake from milk it was amazing   I would try this place one more time but I think I would do the steam bun and the noodle dish.  Maybe the rib. Those seemed to be ask for a lot  I do want to recognize that momofuku did reach out to me about my review. Victor was very kind and offered to make a reservation for a re visit.   Also mentioned talking to the chef.  I do appreciate such efforts.  Thank you victor

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DLqMdbPcQv6_CwqEgErUNw.text: I've seen David Chang in many food TV shows, I was exited to try his place in Vegas my home town. The pork belly buns were very tender and very enjoyable. We ordered shoyu and soba ramen, shoyu ramen was not good, the broth did taste strange, the noodles too soft and the toppings not impressive. The spicy cold soba another disappointment. I understand they are putting a twist, most of the time I like innovation but I did not get it. There other ramen joints in town I pay half of the price and they are very satisfying.

mouKQVdqoARJuBhP3cT-yg.text: My sister has been an avid David Chang follower for years now, and this was her dream spot for lunch! We came out here right at opening time on a Saturday morning, and were not disappointed. What the pho cocktail was a very interesting taste, but not very reminiscent of a bowl of pho. I understood some of the ingredients used, like jalapenos and basil, but the cocktail itself had qualities that were more sour than what you would expect in a bowl of pho. I got the bo ssam rice bowl with a poached egg, and it was a revelation. The kimchi rice underneath a hearty serving of pork shoulder with all the classic Korean sides was a perfect marriage of flavors. We also got the sweet and sour long beans, which were sauteed to perfection (just the right amount of bite to the beans so they weren't a soggy mess), along with the Denver steak, Duck Confit Fried Rice, and the chef's special (crispy chicken leg served on top of a bed of veg). Our server was hands down one of the most well-informed, accommodating and friendly servers we experienced while staying in Vegas. He was passionate about food and informing us guests about the menu, which made it so much easier for us to order!  I'm glad my sister made reservations for this place! It was a fantastic experience.

N4maCVANoBzvRm9OFWBDqg.text: Located on the 2nd floor of Cosmo. Average for the hype. This place can get busy, there was a 30 minute wait around lunch time.  Prices are pretty high for what you get. Started off with crispy potato appetizer ($12). It was a good starter, potatoes had nice seasoning to it and was definitely crispy.  Ordered the Pork Ramen ($17). The pork was soft, flavorful, and delicious. The ramen and broth however was very bland. The broth had no flavor to it.   Took a long time for food to come out, especially since they were a little busy.

5a6JWtw9qIe7JOgjFIbW6g.text: Made a reservation for 7 at 1:30PM on a Saturday afternoon and was seated right away. Love the ambiance and lighting of the place; lots of natural light and spacious seating. Overall, servers are very friendly but service is on the slow side. It took 20 minutes for us to meet our server and food came out very slowly.   I tried the shiitake buns which were very yummy; the sauce gave it a slight kick and contrasted the hoisin sauce, in a good way! I ordered the ginger scallion noodles and while I'm not a huge fan of ginger, the ginger flavor isn't too strong. Flavor overall was mild, tasted very light and clean. Personally felt like the toppings were a bit much in terms of ratio to the noodles.   I also tried a bit of the katsu chicken and loved it. Strong shiitake flavor, chicken was tender, but gravy made it a bit heavy.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly ramen.
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ginger scallion noodles.
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katsu chicken.

lmFoN3QiNBUE55LHfq0yzg.text: It was the table location that makes this David Chang restaurant a five-star restaurant in my book.  Passing other patrons in crowded seating areas, we were seated in the only window seating with a clear view of Paris and the Eiffel Tower!  Manny the waiter was patient with us and had many recommendations.  Since we had experienced Majordomo down in LA and I watched all eight episodes of Ugly Delicious, I felt competent enough to understand what we might like, and try.  I thought we might try the pork ssam sauce entree, but was persuaded to try the beef ribs, which I was conflicted over, as I could have it in Los Angeles, but I caved in and wanted the evening to be memorable, as we were with my daughter's Fiance, and celebrating her birthday.  Something not offered  was the Korean Elote, with the fusion of Mexican corn tastes, with Korean style heat and vegetables which made for a lovely taste all the way down.   When dining at a David Chang restaurant, always try the fish, which is cooked perfectly and tasty, with hints of spice you just can't place, but delicious with fish.  At this particular location, it was the whole Branzino with a grilled lemon in the head and de-boned.  A very delicious dish.  The overall evening was perfect, with a 9:00 reservation and seated almost immediately.  If you get a chance, try to get a table with Manny the waiter!

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilled Spicy Noodles
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rack of Beef Short Ribs
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Korean Elote

6yiV3LdviH6w-frwIinBPw.text: Signature dishes IMO: Get the raw bar dishes (especially the scallop ceviche!!) and the buns.  This place is pretty big. It may look small from the outside but there is a whole separate (really big) dining room in the back.   So happy they opened up in Vegas. If you win big money at the casino, you can splurge on the $$$ ramen. It was too costly for me to try but I'm sure it's fabulous.   My favorite dish of the whole weekend for me was momo's scallop ceviche. Pretty awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hamachi raw bar dish
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buns + scallop ceviche

hGSXwkR-dH_1rd_Ow_WMeQ.text: Oh. My. Gosh. Momofuku was amazing!   We traveled all the way from Austin, TX and were so happy to try the Black Truffle Ramen! We got the pork belly bun as an appetizer and every bite was just tender and heavenly. Buns have been a part of my life growing up and it's probably one of the best I ever had.   The truffle ramen was extremely rich, as it should be, and we love love love truffle and we ate the whole bowl. There was so much truffle! It's $48, but definitely a bowl to share and extremely worth it.  We'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly bun
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black Truffle Ramen

0tKHFYl2OVKgLzhi1mCPUg.text: The cauliflower and brussel sprouts were the favorite of the table!  I liked the special - truffle ramen, the noodles are al dente if that's your thing. The sweet potatoes are also a good bet as a side. The view of the strip from the back room is a good one.

6tsXctLqyxOMPhcwod3S9g.text: I heard alot of hype about this place but my overrall experience was interesting. Momofuku definitely stands out and has a unique twist to all their food. This is not a sushi/sashimi place. And I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone who likes to stick to safe choices- burgers, sandwiches, sushi etc.  I heard it was mainly known for its ramen, however they did not have the pork belly ramen on the dinner menu so we were all confused. But when we asked they said they do offer the pork belly ramen...So..a little confused as to why a popular dish wasn't on the menu? And they didn't have alot of choices of ramen either. Most of us ordered the pork belly ramen and ordered lots of appetizers:  -Pork belly ramen: The broth was a little salty, the pork belly was very soft and easy to chew. The noodles were okay, there was nothing "wow" about it. The buns tasted bland. -Pork belly buns- Again the pork belly was tender and good, but eating it with the bun was just a fail. The pork belly was too big to eat with the bun, it would've been easier if the meat was cut in smaller pieces maybe? - Shrimp buns: Shrimp buns were a little easier to eat but again it kept falling out as we tried taking a bite. The shrimp was good though with a nice sweet sauce. -Spicy rice cakes: The rice cakes are actually fried and diced into squares. It doesn't taste like korean spicy rice cakes but it a sweet slight soy sauce type of flavor that was pretty good. -Hamachi: THIS was probably my favorite small plate. It was soft and the cucumbers really complimented the fresh taste. I wish they gave abigger serving of the hamachi. It's $24 for a tiny plate! -Shishito Peppers: When I got a waft of the peppers it gave off that feeling where you can feel the spiciness with your eyes. But when I took a bite, I didn't taste anything! It felt like I was eating steamed peppers, and I couldn't taste the lime or saltiness. My boss disagreed, but must be just my tastebudz. -Crispy Potatoes: My second favorite item on the menu. So good. These were basically roasted potatoes but grated cheese and green onions. Nicely seasoned and crispy on the outside, soft and hot on the inside. I wished I was eating this with breakfast, not ramen...  There's a couple more plates we ordered but I didn't try them.  Overrall the food was interesting. My gripe about this place is that the food is unique but these small plates would be great compliments to other foods that they don't offer or are too expensive. The crispy potatoes would be great with the rotisserie prime rib, if only that wasn't $72...  Service was prompt and efficient. The waiter was attentive and came around to always refill our waters which I really appreciated. Most convenient part was the lazy susan. However the prices here are just mad. $14 for a small pickle plate? Nah. Will I come back here? Probably not, but I'm glad I tried it.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly ramen
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Potatoes

d37iQUZsdWxUyTYKTXwlpg.text: Love the place.  I was disappointed that was was not able to get the strip view. The food was great.

VSK5Pljwa-ci6DmzeLi1-g.text: Try skipping the bar (although the bar items looked amazing). Go to the back and enjoy the full dinner menu.  Had the shishito peppers, the cold noodle dish (can't remember the name), and the cod.  Omg, the cod.  It was one of the best-cooked cod I've eaten in a while.  David Cheng does a brilliant job melding Korean and Japanese cuisines together into a brand new wonderfulness cuisine.  My mom, who's an amazing cook and who can be quite critical of non-authentic Korean or Japanese food, was quite impressed and thoroughly enjoyed the food.

qI7CCSWGd96XZtrdw5Wwxg.text: I gave Momofuku a chance again and after all the bowls of ramen I've had in between, I will say this is a good bowl. It's not traditional by any means but it's David Chang's great rendition of ramen with quality ingredients. I would say definitely try a bowl from Momofuku once just to say you have.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Ramen // pork belly &amp; shoulder, slow poached egg

PviucEX0njWMvjfwxXCojw.text: Momofuku has arrived in Vegas inside the 2nd floor of the Cosmo.  This is my FYI for all Vegas related reviews: Like every restaurant in Vegas, it is expensive. If you're complaining about price, you should probably not be in Vegas.   Moving along, wow, ambiance is sleek. And you have a nice view of outside too, which was unexpected but lovely. The wait staff is extremely attentive- I don't think my water cup was ever less than half full and I was definitely taken care of. Almost too much attention, honestly.  Food was good! We aren't the biggest morning-after-a-heavy-night-of-drinking eaters, so spare us in that we didn't try too much:  ginger scallion noodles: these would have been good, but goodness, the cucumbers are wayyyy too salty. Everything else was good tho, so I just ended up avoiding eating the cucumbers tbh.   chicken buns: these were amazing. I would go back and just order these until I wanted to throw up. Huge fan.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pa3g2qHhef5f2YM0vwRghw.text: First off, have to say I've been a fan of David Chang since the "Mind of a Chef" series, but never have been able to try any of his restaurants. So really happy he opened something in Las Vegas and was finally ably to try his food. Pro tip: we went for lunch on a Friday and had no wait time. The lunch menu also has rice bowls which are pretty reasonable (less than $20 and big servings).  There's a reason why people love his food. It's so darn tasty! Our group tried the shishito peppers, spicy pickles, and lamb ribs to start. Awesome to say the least. Warning: the spicy pickles are searing hot even for us veteran Asians. Would avoid for the faint of heart.   I got the Bo Ssam bowl and man, it was delicious. My wife got the famed Shoyu Ramen and it also did not disappoint. Of course, we also tried the pork buns. I think I could've eaten two more of those things they were so good.  Service was also very on point. Place has a chic modern vibe with David Choe art on the walls. And convenient location if you are staying in the Aria, Cosmo, Vdara complex. Anyway, one of the few places which has lived up to the hype IMO.

w67PctpD0TzMJAhkJ6rjsA.text: Delicious! I had no idea what I was getting into! Pork belly buns were awesome, the chilled noodles were refreshing and tasty, but the winner of the night was the steamed branzino with the grilled lemon and brown butter dashi! We were supposed to have dinner at the Bacchanal but we didn't think we could handle a buffet so we chose this place and boy were we glad!

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TCwjjXXCyQgTPhL_wQ5nXA.text: overall thought it was good, but expensive.  pork belly bun was good but pretty expensive.  dry aged ribeye was okay.  shishito peppers were good.  long beans were good.  branzino was good.  grilled lamb ribs were very good.

l44sYp8Tls0z91M5TjK2ww.text: Food was good. Service was, idk, not so much. manager was a douche and was very annoying.

5VGCNA6uyU6gb0I_41sSzw.text: Extraordinary late night supper choice at Peach Bar. Engaging administration that ensured we got what we needed. Suggested ramen was eminent just like the made mixed drinks. Directly at the highest point of the elevator in the Cosmopolitan.

ApR7fpn5mKQ0MdZwP3eWBA.text: I really wanted to like this place because I have heard good things from different people. Unfortunately our first experience will hinder us from coming back.   It was our very first day in Vegas, our first meal in Vegas, and our FIRST TIME in Vegas. (no pressure) We were staying at the Cosmopolitan and side note the hotel was amazing. Definitely coming back for the hotel. We got at the restaurant mid afternoon. There was no line and they were not busy. I would say this is best time to come in.  Our server was knowledgeable of the menu. We told her it was our first time in the restaurant and asked for recommendations. I wanted ramen so bad but they only have two options for hot ramen. I saw the duck entree but didn't think twice because I don't eat duck. When the server gave us a gist of the menu, one that she recommended was the duck. So here I go again with, "When in Vegas" I tried something new, for the very first time. We ordered two appetizers to share, chilled brussel sprouts and crack potatoes. The brussels were good palate cleanser. They were light and didn't have an overwhelming flavor. The crack potatoes were addicting. They were crack alright. We also ordered the their famous bun, both pork and shrimp. They were delicious but for the portion I thought it was pricy. My girlfriend was excited because she can't eat duck around me because I don't eat it.   Now with all the build up, we were excited for the duck. Everything so far has been tasty. Until the duck came. I took the first bite and all I could taste was salt. In my head I thought "this is how it's supposed to taste." So I got a little bit of the rice underneath to eat it with. To my horror the rice was salty too. Everything was so so salty. Working in hospitality in the F&B I try not to send food back. But this dish was so overwhelmingly salty I had to. We flagged our server down and told her that the dish was salty. She apologized and told us she will let the chef know. She also told us that she was either going to make a new one or have us order something else on the menu.   We waited patiently.   She came back and told us the Chef was informed and is already making a new one. (What happened to us ordering something else instead? Do we not get that option anymore?) I said thank you and the server walked away. My girlfriend and I had a little discussion and concluded that we no longer want to eat anymore because 1.We didn't have a choice whether we still want the duck and 2. we lost our appetite. We called our server and asked whether it was too late. She said she rang it in as soon as she returned the duck. She said she will go back and check. She came back to our table with the duck plate in hand. We stared at the dish and my girlfriend and I just looked at each other.   By this point we just wanted to leave. We didn't touch the plate. The server came back and asked what was wrong with it. We said we weren't hungry anymore and if would could just have it boxed. We paid and still left twenty percent tip. We're not mean people, we just didn't enjoy the experience at all particularly our first meal in Vegas.

Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vfLTdB3H2aa1jbThJuVF9g.text: I don't get what all the hype is about.  The service sucked and the food was just alright.  What's the point of asking if we're celebrating a special occasion when you're just going to forget about it and not do anything?  I will say their pork in general was really juicy but the slow service and lack of attention ruined our experience.    Our baos and appetizers came out fairly quickly and we ended up waiting half an hour for our ramen and ssam to come out.  They did give us some extra appetizers, but after thirty minutes of waiting, I wasn't really hungry anymore.    Pork bao was juicy and fatty, but for $7 I expected a bigger bun.    Brussel Sprouts & Cauliflower was bitter AF and burnt.  The worst thing we ordered.    The pork ramen was not worth the wait and most of us didn't finish it.  If you've ever had ramen in Japan, just don't bother coming here.  You'll be unimpressed.  The Pork Ssam was recommended by our server.  The pork was tender but the thing came with literally three lettuce wraps.  Someone needs to tell their chef to check the pork to lettuce ratio.  It also came with some rice and kimchi.  We didn't even finish this dish because we were all full because of the wait.

t4PFjI6VhxHer-Bn4_4fpA.text: Food was amazing. Definitely up to the hype. Their sparkling water was delicious, the only things is they made it seem like the sparkling water was on the house. It would have been nice if they had told us it was $1 each in addition they charged us for extra cups we didnt order. We ordered the Duck Ssam and were quite deceived with the amount that was served to us. Felt that for what was being served that it was well over priced but its Las Vegas so it is expected

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unagi Bao with arugula

rVjIgWwQ1A4mkkDV6-cx0w.text: This review is only for the Milk Bar portion. I was super excited when I stumbled across Momofuku on Yelp yesterday, I've been to the New York milk bar but not any of his restaurants in other cities. I was considering dining here for dinner tonight so I stopped by earlier when I was in the cosmopolitan.  You can stop by the milk bar and just do take out dessert which was great. I bought a cornflake chocolate chip cookie for $3, and it was fantastic. They have shakes, other cookies, and other types of desserts as well, I believe they have alcoholic milkshakes too. The counter girl was helpful in helping me determine what kind of cookie to buy, also. She said that they opened around the beginning of 2017 too so they've only been open about three months.  I definitely will be back! Their desserts are so tasty.

iKSBbNle3-U6Le2hRzO8PQ.text: For a $15 dish Ginger Scallion, the dish size is small and food is greasy, would not recommend for lunch or dinner if you are hungry.

PfisVE6BATMB20BGdniT0A.text: Went here for lunch. While I do not usually love or hate ramen, my friend suggested I try the ramen here and it was one of the best I've had. Not so good that I now love ramen, but good enough that I would order the pork ramen again. The egg and pork inside it was perfectly cooked and the noodles had a nice bite to it. The service here was good as well, though they spent a lot of time trying to sell me on desserts when I just wanted to leave already.  I also ordered an unagi bao. The bao was good, but didn't get a lot of unagi flavor from it.  All in all I'd go back.

t9_8UlM1LARsPfB0n9Movw.text: YUM! After watching Ugly Delicious on Netflix I knew I had to check out David Chang's restaurant in Vegas. My boyfriend and I went here for lunch around 11 on a Sunday. Even though we didn't have a reservation we were seated right away at the bar which was perfect because we got to have an inside look of the kitchen. I noticed they also have seating with a strip view so if you want to have lunch or dinner with a view of the strip I recommend making a reservation and requesting that. Service was really good and we both said we would come again. My boyfriend and I both ordered the shoyu pork ramen and it was so good! The ramen includes pork belly and pork shoulder and a nice slow poached egg. The ramen is garnished with scallions, nori, cooked soybeans, and narutomaki. The ramen broth was very flavorful and the noodles were cooked perfectly. The pork belly was melt in your mouth delicious. You get a lot of pork meat which was nice since the ramen is $17 a bowl. I noticed they also have chick pea ramen if you're a vegetarian. While sitting at the bar we were able to see them make ssam with rotisserie chicken and the 5 spice rotisserie duck. Both looked so delicious! The ssam meals are served with bibb lettuce and rice for wrapping and are easily shareable. The duck looked simply heavenly. You can get the duck with the ssam meal or as a large format meal for 3-4 people (keep in mind that it's $200 if you do the large format). Besides the ramen, most other things on the menu are definitely Vegas priced. If you have the money to spend or want to treat yourself for a special occasion check this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from the bar
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4FtecrAww3pDg4P8gRBhCw.text: One of my favorite spots in Las Vegas.  The food is excellent, of course, and the place is well organized to get you in and out. Nothing but praise.

iXJm6lWLb3StXpXHPmKxrw.text: Believe the hype. This place is for real. Momofuku Vegas has a modern interior with an open view of the kitchen where the magic happens. The food is pricey and worth it.   We started with a pickle plate, which includes  kim chee and various other sweet and savory and spicy items.   I had the pork ramen, which features tender shredded pork and pork belly in a silky broth with stretchy ramen noodles. The chili oil addition is mildly spicy and the shiitake addition is pickled. The bowl made me feel healthier and happier. It is the best ramen.   My dining companion went for a truffle special ramen with 6oz of shaved French truffle. It had a little bit of a bigger noodle and had a delicate flavor of truffle. She loved it. I would never order it, because how could I order anything other than the pork ramen?

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That is a lot of truffle!
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh that pork ramen!

x7srOiFt5yEc6Gqyo8MbRg.text: Our first visit here, being a David Chang fan I was looking forward to a nice meal.. but to my disappointment the meal I ordered: Rotisserie Jidori Chicken was way way too salty, the pork bun was way too fattening, I mean how can a strip of pork belly consist of 95% pure fat, hardly any meat left on that belly, the pork belly ramen was mediocre at its best also.  As an Asian American who has traveled quite extensively over the years, I can tell you the quality of the meal I had tonight will never make it there on its first day.. oh and that bearded hipster manger guy just stands there looking pretty and does nothing.. sigh!   David Chang, it's time for a major Quality Control/overhaul at this joint!! I hope you will read this review!

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

D80ey6d_bFqYFPa0AQ3npA.text: Ramen was awesome. I know people have different tastes and preferences so I'll explain what I liked about it.   Noodles were chewy and flavorful and soaked up the broth well. The breath was clean, deep, balanced. The meat was flavorful and tender.  I'm no food expert but I am Korean and have had my fair share of ramen (being from San Jose) and I thought it was excellent.  Buns were good, but not worth the price imo haha. just go to a cheap Chinese place and get the same thing for cheaper..  As you would expect from a nice place in Vegas, staff were friendly and service was great.

oHQXkf6YNdUdF-r_lO2NGA.text: This place is beyond five stars! I won't recommend it for vegetarians though since the options can be very limited! located inside cosmopolitan .. this restaurant usually comes with wait times! But the wait is worth it.. if you are not super hungry then share a noodle bowl and go for two starters!!

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vH2cL0aW_4eJQKxYRz1qCg.text: Wow!!! This place is amazing! I went here with a colleague whom was in town for a conference at the cosmopolitan. The food is sooo good and the portion size is large. The taste was authentic. I had a chickpea chicken ramen bowl. It was so good and had leftovers to spare. If you are looking for a ramen bowl and great view of the strip, you should check this place out.

svSgu6isuykYZen_br9koQ.text: Very similar to the places in NYC. Again the ramen are good, but the Pork Belly bun is the best thing on the menu.

7sc7cCBQ5dzBf87y8kIKqQ.text: I am very sad to write this but I was really looking to coming here as I visited Momofuku in New York a few years ago and had there Ramen and was so amazing,well good news I live in Cali and heard they opened one in Vegas in the Cosmopolitan hotel, so of course I booked a flight to come to Vegas, made a reservation at Momofuku. I have mix reviews, I had a reservation at 6:30 pm but was late by 25 minutes due to traffic on the strip, but the hostess said don't worry we will have a table for you, so great customer service there, so remember the whole reason I wanted to come to Momofuku was for the Pork belly ramen, well the waiter sat us I looked at the menu and they didn't have it, so sad face for me, I asked the waiter may I order the pork belly ramen and he said no it's only for lunch or late Night, well I ordered some other things I really didn't want like the $58 buck rotisserie chicken but I didn't want to leave cuz I was Already there, so a few moments later the next table had pork ramen being served to them, my waiters switched and I was Just disappointed, because of what I would have ordered due to what he said I couldn't order, the 2nd waiter did give us the pork belly ramen and said even though it's not on the menu you can ask for it, but I did earlier but the first waiter said I couldn't , anyways there was another mix up where I ordered 2 pork baos too and I never got them u till the end of the service because I asked if we Did order them and he said yes... hmmm I'm just disappointed not the best  first impression for the people I brought after I was hyping it up, I am just kinda upset cause I feel I overpaid $58 bucks for the chicken that was dry where i could have gotten it at  costco for 4.99. I'm here until Mon so we will see if give it go :(  Rika was nice and addressed my concerns and the customer service was great so I am changing it to a 3 do to there efforts of making the customer happy

PwXofez-i_azD1GU5aLDow.text: Okay, I'll admit my ramen experience mostly consists of "Top Ramen" during my lean years. So anything would be an improvement right? Especially a restaurant rumored to be so great? No. Nope. I must have come on an off day. Today must be kitchen try-outs. Probably? I hope so.   The place looks nice, expertly decorated. The music during lunch is way to loud. No, I'm not that old.   I think I'll grab some "Top Ramen" on the way home.

JMxz5WeehB0gaBQ9Lh6ffw.text: Mika is an angel! I took my picky friend today to momofuku and Mika was completely understanding and helpful in giving us suggestions and alternative dishes. She made us feel completely welcomed and valued. Please give her a raise! Good customer service should be recognized.

tC8dqMahqUy740m8xxwSUA.text: not a good place to have asian food in Las vegas. The food is cold and very salty. The host look like they dont need customer if you keep asking them when is your turn to get in.

EheNUj9yku5q3j5-QmhLVQ.text: Good but nothing I'd craved.. The ramen size left me wanting more. I could eat 3 servings easily. There are better ramen options off strip but I won't mention no names.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilled noods!

F6qqkI3pZzjUsbRTA8iQSA.text: Worth every penny. We're regular people but this was for our anniversary. We had a tasting menu especially crafted with our minor parameters in mind. Dale, our server is wonderful, and helped make our experience perfect. This is a great restaurant- if you're on a budget their ramen and Bao menu can be had at the bar.   We would go back for the food, the staff, and for Dale's kind professionalism.

uEUCtQh-EajQwi9bN2zXUQ.text: We ate at the bar. Danny was our bartender. He was awesome and suggested dishes he thought we would like. We had the Bigeye Tuna, Spicy Cucumbers, Shishito Peppers, Pork Belly Buns, Sichuan Lamb Ribs, Chilled Spicy Noodles and the Steamed Whole Branzino.   Bigeye Tuna was my favorite. The shaved foie gras melted in my mouth and paired well with the tuna and strawberries.   Spicy cucumbers were chopped thick and had togarashi on it and was a great take on the cucumbers you would get at a sushi bar.   Pork Belly Bun was the perfect amount of bun to meat. The pork belly was well-seasoned and had scallion and cucumber in it.   The lamb ribs were savory and had a sauce on it similar to a tzatziki sauce on it.   The chilled spicy noodles were spicy, but not to the point that you couldn't taste the other flavors. It had sausage, and cashews in it. The sauce was like a pesto, but basil flavored.   My hubby loved the branzino. He usually doesn't like whole fish, but I think that was his favorite. It came with a grilled lemon and brown butter dashi. The dashi was so unctuous and really made the fish delicious.   Danny and Ricky(?) were at the bar serving everyone and gave us spectacular service. We will be back.

YsFCCUFVYOcz24ejp2CexA.text: Amazing food & best service! Our waiter was so attentive to everything we need and knows the menu well and how to pair it with drinks. We ordered Oysters to start with, Wagyu beef, their lamb ribs and their pork belly buns. Love it! The buns are soooo addicting! The wagyu melts in your mouth! Our waiter suggested and gave us sake to pair with the wagyu. All in all it was a great dinner and top notch service.

n3TTwhxVWKHWwMLTQGK4Ug.text: Monday night in Vegas, ready for a delicious meal, and Momofuku delivered. Pleasant hostess seated us a few minutes after arriving on time for our reservation. Leilani, our waitress, made the experience exceptional. She guided us to some must haves (her favorites, of course, and she did not disappoint). Shishito, pork belly and shrimp baos, chilled noodles, lamb, scallops, and potatoes with truffles. It was delicious, satisfying,  and fun. Leilani was spicy, sweet, and delicious and we wanted to wrap her energy up and take it home.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A while lot of delicious
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance to heaven

fPQDoS3oYMgX7qSXSg0irw.text: I have been looking forward to eating at a David Chang restaurant for a long time. I was worried that I might have conjured unreal expectations after the long wait... That was quickly dispelled as Momofuku gave me the best meal of my life. Everything was perfect. Seriously. The cocktail?(Toki thyme) Delicious. The pork buns? pork buns?! I still dream about those damn pork buns. The Bo Ssam, 5 spice duck, and lamb rack were perfect too. It was all so good i'm mad I have to go back to regular food.  Our server Kawika was very accommodating to our questions and helped us navigate our way through the menu. I can't wait to go back.

yZoMdp8SlQsUbuP-A3hPXA.text: The staff and chefs are super friendly and the food is amazing. Shot out to chef Steve! Got the shiitake bun and ramen - 10/10. The ramen comes with a very friendly portion of pork. Worth every penny.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XhBCS2Sh5ceJihyJGrDRCg.text: We got seated by the window and had a beautiful view of the strip.  In addition, we had excellent service.  You can order like a sharing menu if you have a big group or you can order a few items together.  The chilled spicy noodles were phenomenal, and the shiitake mushroom bun was out of its world too.  My other friends ordered a sharing menu of lobster and shrimp that looked really good too.

NAEcRzftWcwi9YEb95Q6UA.text: If you're vegan and are thinking of coming here, but you're on the fence about it, please hop over and don't miss out on a great dining experience.  My girlfriend and I are vegan, and I was worried that there wouldn't be enough plant-based options on the menu to offer a filling, satisfying meal. After reading some reviews where people mentioned that there are a few plant-based options on the menu, and the kitchen can make modifications to accommodate vegan diners, I decided to make Momofuku our dinner choice.  Been a fan of David Chang for a while and have always heard good things about his restaurants, so I was really excited to finally have an opportunity to dine at Momofuku.  I made the reservation through OpenTable and specified that we were looking for an all vegan meal. The hostess acknowledged our request at check-in, and our server was very knowledgeable breaking down our available options, and telling us what items could be modified to fit our dietary needs.  We came in at 930pm on a Thursday, and even with the reservation there was a short wait, but it wasn't a big deal. Just gave us an opportunity to grab some drinks at the bar. The bartender was great. Gave us menus and water the minute we sat down. Very attentive.   The hostess sat us in a corner both along the Strip. We had windows that wrapped around that gave us a great view of the Strip with the "Eiffel Tower" in the background. Had a view of the entire restaurant from that perspective as well.  Food was great. One of the best meals we've ever had. I think as the menu changes daily, I don't think I'll go into detail, but nothing we ordered disappointed.  The experience from start to finish left us very happy and satisfied. 10/10 would recommend.

Y3XK_ecHcSU7DAq8wO-t5g.text: One of the most incredible meals I've had - we tried the family style pork shoulder (to die for), the pork belly dumplings (group favorite), and the waitress knew we loved spicy sauce and even made us a special hot sauce to go on our dishes. Worth every dollar!

z1IwRJ0OMPqWGJ60KlbaKA.text: We got into Vegas on a late flight. Went straight to this fabulous place!!!!  We had amazing Nitrate Milk Stout. It came from our state Colorado where beer-snobs flourish, and it was absolutely delish!!  I had a nice cider from England but after tasting Dans I was green with envy.   Next step order pork buns!!!!  Yum yum yum it was mind-blowing flavor. Don't ever not have the pork buns cuz no one should miss them.   Main course was pork ramen with broth to die for!!!  You also gotta have that.   Late at night the menu is limited ---but who cares we had the best things we've ever eaten at Momofuku.   You gotta try this place. It's amazing. We can't wait to go to his place in New York in June!

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork bun. Next time I might just have 6 of these!!!
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Ramen
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The pork master!!

1k7eDFgUa2v8lMSNMhGV3Q.text: The food was excellent! The noodles were cooked to perfection and their pork buns are better then a taco! I'm Mexican so that's hard to type too!!! Only thing I was a little disappointed with was service. I thought all my dinner entrees would come out together or close to it. My Ribs came out after an hour and 20 mins of being there

ptY4ZgoJhpkGDJa3pLwwqA.text: Saturday night dining, celebrating with friends.  We had a great time and enjoyed the friendly staff and services.  We ordered quite plenty: Pork Belly and Shitake buns, Dry Roasted Mussels, Crispy Potatoes....then the Bo Saam.  The buns are definitely a hit.   Be cautious on the large format dining options, they do give generous portions that you'll be sporting Momofuku bags on the strip after a good dinner.  The Watari Bune sake bottle....done!

NWnyC_m50ohzOZ5tTAjvwg.text: The pork ramen was quite good and I would recommend it. The menu was quite small to select from and we couldn't find anything else to order unfortunately.  We visited 1 time and didn't return due to lack of selection.

-Oozv-no9c8iVDJmrx4wgA.text: Our dining experience at Momofuku was a complete disappointment. From the overly solicitous, drugged out waiter to the dull interpretation of "new Asian" cuisine, Momofuku manages to survive on reputation alone. Highly priced and overly done food does not belong in the foodie's list of places to go. Don't follow the throngs of tourists looking for the "it" restaurant, or you'll be sadly disappointed.

6tE1puIUJqc-TcYaVPlXsA.text: I'm soo glad they opened Momofuku, they really needed a good Asian restaurant here at the Cosmo. The pork belly buns are sooo good!!!! The tender pork belly with the cucumbers and onions inside was the perfect balance. Make sure to add their Korean chili sauce Ssam.  We also ordered two pork ramens, it was good, but lacked something. So we added some of the Korean chili sauce to the ramen and it made the Ramen delicious.  Overall the service was excellent. Our waitress Tara went above and beyond with her knowledge and service. We will definitely be back to try all of their other dishes as well.

Oi91vkJiqVaV7iuz-0M8OA.text: Stopped by for for Vegas version of David Chang's restaurant from NYC...atmosphere amazing!! Perhaps had THE BEST waiter of all time as Joshua was something special...not your typical waiter, very open, friendly and NYC rugged but amazingly realistic style...everything he recommended was right on point!! Tried both alcoholic smoothie drinks and both were tasty!! Started with hamachi from raw bar menu with caviar and crispy rice and mustard seeds...amazing!!! This was a corrected order as demanded by Joshua since we told him we are big foodie eaters...and he was 100% spot on. We got the pork belly bao which is 100% must!!! This you seriously cannot miss or else you will be missing something in your life that you don't even know about!! Then had the pork belly ramen which was full of flavor...I was concerned from some "plain tasting" broth reviews but I personally thought it was perfect and full of flavor and I personally loved it!! Finished with ginger scallion noodles which you have to mix before eating and was pretty perfect meal!! Loved every part of it...with Joshua leading the charge!! Great meal and will definitely come back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The amazing hamachi raw bar menu!!! Has caviar and mustard seeds and crispy rice with shredded Nori!!! Incredible!!!
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallion ginger noodle!!! Mix it up first and super tasty!!
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly bao!!! Must must must get...perhaps the best pork belly I have ever had!!!

MeD-B6G6UXBOdy21960QBg.text: Merp-pah.  We came here a few weeks ago with my husbands client. We wanted Ramen. And we didn't know that they only serve it for lunch.  When we saw the dinner menu, we were like, "what the fuck?" For dinner, it's family style and expensive as shit.   I've been to so many places on the strip that are from $10 a person to $200 a person. For 3 of us, we spent rougly $360, with tip. Do I think it was worth that price? No. How much was it worth? About $120...ish.   The food was good, but nothing spectacular. And honestly? This is your average joint on the strip. "We're new and innovative!" No, you're not. Cool decor doesn't make you good. But because you're on the strip, you can get away with this absurd prices. Was the quality good? Yes. But again, I wasn't insanely impressed with anything other than their selection of Japenese Whisky and their buns, hun.  The dishes we all shared (With my 1-5 star ratings):  Crab Deviled eggs *** Pork Belly **** Korean Braised Short Rib*** Crispy Potatoes ** - way too thick of cream that you may gag on. Chicken Karaage ** It's fried chicken. Can't do much more with it.  Pork Belly Bun ***** - best/cheapest thing there.   Oh, and the service was not good. The lady that filled our water 15 times, was nice and great. But we had to flag our waiter each time we needed anything.   Will I go back? For ramen, yes. Am I opposed to spending decent money on great food? No. But there are a pretty heafty handful of places on the strip that really deserve that status and price, in my opinion. And this place falls short for me.

iC_dx9UqVg2-2E9iwVDaJQ.text: Amazing food, amazing service, amazing everything. We were seated before our scheduled reservation, and were greeted with care. I couldn't be happier about the experience here in Las Vegas

0nMPvR65Qm-Uvc59oYAuvw.text: Probably the best experience I've had at a ramen shop, maybe even restaurants in general. The service here felt like I was dining at a 3 Star Michelin restaurant. Our water was never empty. We were greeted by several servers and constantly followed up with by management, servers, and even chefs. I highly highly recommend this place!  On top of that the ramen was BOMB! The pork ramen tasted amazing and the serving size was perfect!  This will be a go to spot every time I visit this city

gIlEccTwDx_-63s44ef2Yg.text: This is my second visit to Momofuku and I have to say it exceeded my expectations and made up for the mediocre service on the last visit. The pork buns - as last time - were absolutely amazing. We got the duck for our group of 6. Saying it serves 4 is an understatement - there was so much food! I'm very glad they don't waste the duck after cutting the breast, they take the lovely bones with meat on them and they cook it some more. Victor carved up the duck and the presentation was on point! Can't wait to go back and try the ramen!

1GJpZWT0W7iT8DZ4q3r2Rg.text: Momofuku is always delicious -- and that's why we decided to visit even in vegas.   The bartender was excellent, made us one of the best old fashioneds I've ever had!   The buns are amazing and perfectly seasoned, just like home. The ramens are rich and tasty and oh so satisfying, and pretty much everything else is spot on.   To save a few dollars & a long wait, stop by in the afternoon, when they have a decent amount of food options, and way fewer people.

ibanWQ4RZ7PEN0viWvuU8w.text: Don't order the truffle ramen. It's $50 buck for a sale portion and it wasn't good. Too expensive!

TP4z11ggk8NxqJ4YiQjH2g.text: I've been to Vegas countless times for conferences and trade shows and have had dinner at almost every place in town. At a certain point, dinner becomes about more than just the food. Josh hosted our small group of 3 at the bar and was an absolute legend. I'll be returning to this restaurant every time I'm in town.

3OCz-JTTDsHt6bHpTqcgYg.text: Awesome.  Absolutely awesome.  This is the perfect Las Vegas restaurant.  Momofuku is the perfect combination between casual, hands on eating and 5 star flavor pairings. I'd feel comfortable in a Hawaiian shirt or a suit here.  The staff is friendly and not pretentious.  The flavor profiles are unbelievable.  This restaurant, with its fun juxtaposition, is an absolute must go when you're in Vegas.

P6qvL_xvMlXb_x20fwKB8Q.text: The Pork Ramen was Amazing!  The Pork was smokey deliciousness and the pork belly was like butter.

LN2B1dWTgHsB3oxtkXunTA.text: DAT PORK BELLY DOEEEEEE~  If I were just writing a review about the pork belly, I'd definitely give it 10+ stars if that were possible, because that pork belly was THICCCC, juicy, and tasted like the food form of perfection. It makes me want to move to Vegas just so I can eat it every day.  With that said- the pork belly was my favorite part of the entire meal. My friends and I ordered a pork belly bun each. At first, we were skeptical because it costs $7 for one bun, but after ordering, we honestly wished we were ballin' enough to order 5 more- EACH. If you're asking yourself if it's worth paying $7 for just one bun.....trust me and just do it.   There are also two large slices of pork belly in the Shoyu Pork Ramen. The meat portions were really generous (2 huge slabs of pork belly + some extra pulled pork on the side) The noodles were pretty good (semi-curly ramen) and were chewy goodness! The poached egg was good, but I personally prefer my ramen eggs soft-boiled because I don't have to worry about them cracking into my soup. The ramen also comes with cooked bean sprouts, as well as scallions (or green onions??). If you're into sesame seeds, we were given some free of charge after asking! Personally, I prefer Tonkotsu (creamy pork) broth for my ramen, so I wasn't a huge fan of the Shoyu broth because it tasted similar to classic udon broth. Despite this, the broth was tasty and quite refreshing, especially after a late Saturday out in Vegas.   The only reason I docked one star from my review was due to the service. Our server was pretty attentive at first, but seemed to forget about us more and more throughout the meal. He began serving other tables and taking their orders waaaay before he took ours, even though we arrived well before those parties. When it was time to ask for our check, we struggled to flag him down and ended up asking a random server to grab it for us. No big deal to be honest, but just thought that because of it, I couldn't give Momofuku the full 5 stars.   Overall, a good experience! Hopefully they will come out with more types of ramens, specifically Tonkotsu! If the pork belly was that good, I'm sure the pork broth would be insanely amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shoyu Pork Ramen
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ssäm sauce- similar to Korean gochujang paste
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Belly bun- can&#39;t stop daydreaming about it

SHL2Sn4Sw6sEFSlfEM2gSw.text: Located on the second level next to the AllSaints clothing store.   We were able to get a seat at the bar. Aside from the not-so-cheerful, no smiles server who attended to us, the food was fantastic. She answered our questions and the food didn't take long to come out.  The pork belly ramen was amazing, and I also had a shrimp bun. The shrimp bun essentially was like a shrimp patty inside a "soft taco-shell" like bun with a sauce and lettuce. Both were tasty and I only wish I had time to order more from their menu.  The place is definitely good for groups. It can get loud in there, but for this type of food and the quality and presentation, I'm a fan and would go back again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp bun
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly ramen

IvF4pB2MUdyYH2uoSUEnSg.text: Came here pretty late at night for their late night menu and got the garlic noodles and pork belly bao. Service was pretty good. Prices were high but I expected that. The pork belly bao had good flavor and I liked it. The garlic noodles, which was what I came for, were sadly disappointing. There was almost no flavor to them except for the four or five mushroom slices in there. Those really had to carry the dish because the noodles and what little sauce there was had no flavor. I was really disappointed and I can really only recommend the bao.

sDxNWPukWkRR8ObjzUITLA.text: I've eaten at the NYC location, and when I found that Momofuku was in LV, I definitely wanted to come back. BUT....I can't recommend coming to this location. I got food poisoning dining here!!! Pretty much ruined my Saturday night in Vegas being stuck in my hotel room throwing up all night while all my friends were out. I read that others got food poisoning here as well on Yelp, so I guess I wasn't the only unlucky one.

efAWsuHL7sSkGlHKDq-cZA.text: This was my first time at one of David Chang's restaurants, so the expectations were high, and Momofuku Las Vegas exceeded them.  Firstly, do NOT skip the pork belly buns. By far my favorite dish and I wish we had ordered more. We also had the Hawaiian kampachi, which was a little underwhelming but that might be because we were served that after the buns. Then we had the ginger scallion noodles, which were perfectly al dente and tasted so fresh. For our mains, we got the black cod, which was a special, and the pork tomahawk. Both were excellent.   If I were to critique one thing, I'd say some of the dishes had just a little too much salt for my palate. Other than that, service was wonderful. I can't wait to try Majordomo in LA!

bSMLWBy5BmziCmdasWaQsQ.text: Great service & yummy cocktails  Pork ramen: standard, not Wow, softboiled egg was the highlight, noodles were ok  Pork bao: generous serving of pork belly but at $7 a bao, it better be a good size, needed more pickled cucumber though  Bucatini pasta was yummy: cross between cacio e Pepe and carbonara   Big Tuna with shaved Foie gras: winner! Get this! Poached then chilled then shaved foie gras is genius! Why haven't I had this before?

8c-zX0mHr2EFK2zmRRLhug.text: Stopped here with a friend before the Garbage concert for a drink and small bites. Man do I wish we came with a bigger group. The lobster and duck dishes looked amazing.   We had a reservation (recommended for dinner) and got seated at the bar. It was really cool to see the chefs assembling the dishes. We ordered a half dozen oysters and the shishito peppers. Both were awesome. I forgot what kind of oysters they were, but very mild and smooth. I wasn't a fan of the smoked roe they gave with it, but I'm not big on smoky things. The shishito peppers were tasty, and the lime salt they used was like crack.   It's a little noisy so if you're looking for a quiet place to eat...this isn't it.   I'll be back with a bigger group to try that lobster though!

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

81tGqoJwlD2hs33KrKSkNw.text: Loved the Ramen, they were even gracious to make it as my late night meal even though it was a lunch menu item. Sitting at the bar watching the cook and chef, was like watching artists.  The pork belly bun, was a perfect snack. The only thing I did not care for was the cocktail. It was half a glass and not my taste, especially for $16.   I would definitely go back, but stick to just the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Belly Bun

Do6yjA8Ndu7DHuOIy-jcEw.text: Located inside the Cosmopolitan Hotel in Las Vegas.   My sister picked Momofuku for us to have dinner at when we were in Vegas a couple of weeks ago. I tend to get bossy or Alpha when it comes to picking a restaurant to try LOL Yelp Elite Problems ha ha. I have no idea why but my sister wanted to eat here, my first reaction was, "y tho?" lol it has under 1000 reviews. From all the restaurants in Vegas. Anywho, she said she wanted to try it because of the Milk Bar next door and something about it being popular in New York?.   We came here on a Wednesday night and it was actually packed. The place definitely reminds me of a New York Japanese restaurant! The hostess said that the wait would be about 45 minutes. Luckily we found two seats at the bar which was "first come, first served".   I love me some pork belly buns so I got two of them and my sister ordered the shiitake and shrimp buns along with a beer. Everything we had was good. It's not bad priced at all, considering it's inside a nice hotel in LV. The bao buns are about $7 each, anywhere else you go it's probably going to cost $4-5ish. The bartender was really nice. Especially for a Las Vegas bartender. He didn't rush us to eat or get out even though there was a lot of people waiting to sit down.   Overall, a great restaurant/bar. Next time I come I'll be sure to make a reservation so that we can sit down in the dining room!

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Belly, Shrimp and Shiitake Bao Buns

Vjcmrjusj9BvQaAREI_W8g.text: Exterior = 4/5 This is a Japanese restaurant located on the second floor of the Cosmopolitan. As we walked towards the restaurant, we noticed there was a line outside. I breathed a sigh of relief as we walked in straight to the hostess stand to claim our reservation spot. From the outside, there wasn't much place to wait, aside from standing near a bordering wall since to the left of the restaurant opening is Milk.   Interior = 5/5 Upon entering the restaurant, we passed through individuals munching away in the bar before entering the actual restaurant space. I liked the lighting in the restaurant which (I felt) was attributed to the large panel windows, which we were lucky enough to be seated by. I think this would be so relaxing on a rainy day (we just had cloudy, but I was okay with that).  Service = 5/5 Our server was bubbly, and she recommended some options that were not on the menu that we decided to order. She also would check on us a bunch of times.   Order = 4/5 Yuzu lemonade: 5/5 We are biased because we like anything yuzu and citrus-y. Boyfriend liked it because it wasn't too sweet or tart, or watered down. It was a nice balance to the alcoholic drink we got.  Dancing Daisy: 4/5 I was a little nervous when I read it had artichoke and chocolate - I was like whoa there. The server described it as an earthy tasting drink, and a popular one at that. When it came, I stared at the drink as it was topped with pepper. I was also trying to see if I could see the artichoke (don't know why). The drink smelled refreshing, and when you drank it there was a subtle aftertaste of chocolate.  Big Eye Tuna: 5/5 First time we had foie gras! We liked this appetizer and wished they gave more, but I can see how the foie gras can be too rich in higher amounts. The foie gras would literally melt as we are eating it, so I would use tuna to scoop it up. The asian pears brought a crunch to the plate, since everything else was soft.   Wagyu bao: 3/5 It was good, meat was soft. The flavors were nice. It only came with one bao - which for the price I was hoping for two. Overall it was okay.  Black Truffle Ramen: 3/5 The size was a nice if for one person. We shared but it worked out because we got other items. It was good, but I felt it was over hyped. You can taste the truffle. I liked the broth because it was light but I feel like the meat could be softer and more quantity.   Overall = 4/5 It was a nice atmosphere and place to eat. We enjoyed the appetizers a little more than the ramen we had, but that may just mean we have to come back and try another!  Hint = make reservations ahead of time to avoid the line! Also if the truffle ramen is available, the server said it is very limited in availability through the year (the last time it was offered was January 2017).

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black Truffle Ramen
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu bao
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big Eye Tuna

Hik2KzOafYrBRcEilI7g3Q.text: If you're in Vegas & you chose Momofuku you are in for a treat! Sarah helped our server & it was the best service I've ever had she was very knowledgeable about everything on the menu since it was our first time here!  It's family style & we had a group of people. We ordered the spicy cucumbers, roasted corn, hearts of Palm & avocado, & the A5 Kagoshima wagyu potatoes. The potatoes were to die for & well worth it!!! Family style we ordered both the salt & pepper lobster & shrimp, as well as the 5 spice rotisserie duck. WOW! Super delicious, it was packed full of a variation of flavors, tender & juicy.   I would definitely recommend this restaurant if you are in Vegas looking for a really good dining experience as a date night or with a group of friends!

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MEbMEB2qYgsXTX0UgETh_w.text: I was pretty excited to try this place. I am torn between a 3 and 4. I wish I could do half stars. Overall, I would feel this restaurant is like a 3.5.  I made reservations on a Sunday night. I came a little early but they were able to seat us right away. I love the decor of this place. It definitively screams modern Asian fusion.  For food, we ordered the Bo Ssam, pork belly buns, chilled spicy noodles, and grilled asparagus. We all enjoyed the pork belly buns, the flavors were there and I love how it is thick slab of pork belly! My sister commented on how she loved the bun too. It was baked perfectly. We also enjoyed the chilled spicy noodles and grilled asparagus. Overall, great vegetarian options. The grilled asparagus had miso butter on it and it was divine! The main event was the Bo Ssam which consists of low-roasted pork shoulder accompanied by oysters, rice, bibb lettuce, kimchi, hoisin, ssam sauce, and ginger scallion sauce. Overall, we agreed that it is too salty. Too salty that we didn't want to add hoisin sauce to the meat. I was kind of bummed about it. I have to mark off 1 star from my review because I wish they didn't add that much salt. I love sodium as much as the next person but this was a little much.  Service was great though, very attentive and friendly. The server says that David Chang swings by every 3 months or so. Too bad we weren't able to run into him! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bo ssam
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilled spicy noodles
Photo of Momofuku - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly buns

m_EeiBSOW7SHmOp76qc0CQ.text: Asian food designed to fit into the modern hip scene.  I'm going to describe this as multi-Asian "fusion" food. It's tasty regardless, so enjoy and don't read too much into the Korean wraps that come with Vietnamese plum sauce, insipid Kim Chee and mutable Chinese scallion rice.   The crispy potatoes were the best potatoes I've had. The best. That's a bold declaration so you'd do well to order it too. The potatoes were all small in size meaning it's easier to cook them all to the same creamy consistency of excellently and uniformly cooked potatoes. Fried to perfection. Each potato pop into your mouth is an unfolding of the prized sixth flavor - umami. Yaasss!  Check in was... formal. Waiter Kawika was dope. Thanks for bringing aloha to this place!  Interior is definitely cooler than your typical Asian restaurant, so there's the balance of fusion. I'll take it.   Thumbs up!
